Reviews.Title: “Napa-chic”
Reviews.Author: Anna0907
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at Hotel Yountville. I use Trip Advisor regularly but this is the first review I have ever penned. We are a couple in our mid- thirties, almost late-thirties, and this is our kind of place. The rooms are beautiful, think restoration hardware catalog, the service is excellent and the hotel is perfectly located, two minute walk to the best restaurants you could imgaine. Being from the east coast the time change is tough. The resturant on property only serves breakfast beginning at 7:30, we are up earlier. I will spill some secrets-they will pack you a picnic lunch, drive you to dinner and have bikes and iPads at your disposal. We booked a regular room and we were either extremely lucky, or every room as a excellent outside space that we have used regularly. If it is your first trio to Napa, pack layers, at least in Spring and Fall. The property is excellently maintained and trust me I am a critic. (Also the bathroom is gorgeous and has a whirlpool). If you don't love this place and feel perfectly comfortable you are a snob. As a side note we got at peak in a room at the high-end competition down the street - it is lovely but a hotel for your mother, not you. Have a blast in Napa, it is a special place.

Reviews.Title: “Sad to leave...”
Reviews.Author: tesoro1981
Reviews.Content: 4 nights in February was perfection. The rooms are stunning, the service impeccable, the grounds heaven. The room was so beautiful in fact, that we took pictures and want to renovate our existing bedroom to the EXACT specs ! lol. It was sad to leave this place as it is very luxurious and hard to drag yourself back to reality. Gives us more reason to return. Sure the walls are thin and you can sometimes hear the neighbours. But we were lucky enough to only notice it a couple times as the next room was unoccupied for the majority of our stay. I would recommend a second floor room to remove any potential noise from the upstairs neighbours. And the so-called "trailer park" people complain about is really a non-issue. Didnt really notice it at all and probably wouldnt have if I had not read some reviews here. A great stay ! I recommend heading down during the off season. Prices are lower, its quieter, romantic and just as enjoyable, if not more so.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite place!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer W
Reviews.Content: If I could live in the Premium King Suite at Hotel Yountville I would. My huband and I went for a weekend getaway and couldn't have been more impressed. The greeting upon arrival was friendly and because we had read reviews of the noise in the rooms I requested a quite spot on property, they had a vacant upgraded unit that they put us in to ensure we were happy. It was gorgeous, we want to remodel our bathroom to the exact decor. Housekeeping came in to set the mood and give the room a fluff every afternoon so we were welcomed into a fresh setting everytime. The night we got there I had a terrible allergic reaction to the down in the room and they changed all of the linens immediately. Wow! Talk about fantastic service! We will be back and I will be recommending them to everyone I know!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect stay in Napa area!”
Reviews.Author: TXgalDallas_TX
Reviews.Content: Hotel Yountville was the perfect choice for our 3 day weekend in Napa. Great location near all the main towns, yet quaint and quiet for relaxtion after long days at the wineries! Best of all, you can walk thru cute Yountville with lots of dining options. Whether as a couple or with friends, they are the perfect botique like hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, but paper-thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Colleen B
Reviews.Content: I loved this place as soon as I stepped in. The grounds and rooms are beautifully kept and clean. The service is friendly. We stayed in room 311. I was very disappointed by how thin the walls in our room were. We could hear EVERYTHING that was being said and done in both our neighbors' rooms. Honestly, I've had a more restful sleep in a casino/hotel in Vegas. I would highly recommend the 3-course brunch tasting menu at the hotel's Hopper Creek Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “If the Hotel Were Wine, It Would be a Parker 94”
Reviews.Author: RTL212
Reviews.Content: From our travel perspective, the Napa Valley has a lot of ordinary hotels at luxury prices. The Hotel Yountville is an exception. Located a 5 minute walk (if one walks slowly) from the center of the village, the hotel is so fully renovated as to be brand new. Though pretending to be in the spirit of Tuscany, the lobby is no more than a contemporary decorator's cliche with a not very creative Restoration Hardware theme. It is large, spacious and comfortable, and if we hadn't been confused by the incomprehensible reference to Tuscany, we wouldn't have known for the worse. On the way to the rooms, organized into seven separate buildings, you pass by a very California-style sitting area organized around a rectangular fountain with a large gas fireplace (wood would have been so much nicer). The rooms are very large, well decorated, with gas fireplaces, excellent bathrooms and very large closets. Ours had a peaked ceiling and beams and nice light. One drawback to some rooms -- the parking area is very large as it serves all of the separated buildings, and some rooms can't avoid a parking lot view. The small swimming pool is a perfect comfortable temperature, bordered by a nice jacuzzi and another large gas-driven fire pit and a very large, diffused seating area. The highway is very close by but we rarely heard noise; other hotels in the area haven't done well with that but the Yountville did. We were a bit off season but can imagine a bit less desirable stay in full season if families and noisy kids decide to stay around the pool; but we didn't have that problem and found the hotel to be a restful, spacious and very comfortable place.

Reviews.Title: “Did Not Want To Leave!”
Reviews.Author: NorthBayTraveler62
Reviews.Content: I LOVED our stay at this property! So cozy, luxurious and decorated beautifully! The bathroom was like a spa, including great products. The location is great for the Napa/Sonoma area. The only downside is the setting. There is a trailer park and walking path along side the property. :/ I would absolutely stay here again, just would ask for a different spot on the property. We stayed on the lower level (which was pretty quiet), with one floor above us and you park outside your door, very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Erik H
Reviews.Content: This is a great spot for enjoying wine country. Located in the heart of the valley it's a great location to start off your day of tasting. Within walking distance to Bistro Jeanty, REDD and Bouchon. The suites are beautiful. The breakfasts are amazing, Everything you would expect from a luxury hotel in the Napa Valley. Definitely the most comfortable bed we've ever slept in! I wish i knew what brand mattress they have so I could buy one for us at home.

Reviews.Title: “Yountville sparkles”
Reviews.Author: SanFranciscoPeter
Reviews.Content: We recently had a splendid time at Hotel Yountville during a recent trip with my family. Interfacing with the hotel was easy and efficient before our visit. When we arrived our room was not ready but we were immediately soothed by the comfortable and cozy lobby, sipping on complementary Harney & Sons Paris Bergamot tea and Equator coffee with good music. The room itself was inviting and stylish - very California, very modern, with a perfect color palate and lighting, Yountville itself was a great place to stay in wine country with the highest per-capita Michelin starred restaurants at a stone's throw from the hotel. When we visited, the Taste of Yountville festival allowed us to sample many of the town's fine restaurants. We left at the end of the weekend renewed and reinvigorated - exactly what we wanted. Top 10 reasons to go to Hotel Yountville (in no particular order): 1. Fantastic staff. Smiles everywhere. Personal service. Thanks especially to the bartender Corey and the staff at the restaurant. 2. Comfortable bed. A great night's sleep with curtain panels that unfold on all sides of the bed for that dreamy feeling. 3. In room fireplace. Settling down with a glowing fireplace in the background was the perfect end to the day. 4. Hopper Creek Kitchen: One of the highlights of each day was our morning trek to the hotel restaurant. One of the best breakfasts we have had. Farm fresh eggs. Brioche toast with home made jam. Blueberry hotcakes with California pistachios. Freshly squeezed orange juice. Mmmmm. 5. Pool and hot tub: Heavenly and never crowded. 6. Setting: Mountains in the background. Creek running through hotel property. Beautifully landscaped. 7. Turndown service. Locally sourced Kollar chocolates left on the pillow (which we also sampled at the festival) was a special touch, as was the artfully lit evening candle in the bathroom. 8. Complementary lobby Harney & Sons tea, Equator coffee and spa water. 9. Ceiling fans. Together with the curtains around the bed led to a dreamy feeling. 10. Hotel bikes. Free to use for guests. Fantastic perk.

Reviews.Title: “Must stay here!”
Reviews.Author: MysticNick
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good about this Hotel. We were treated very well here by the staff; we were given an upgrade to a Premium Suite and had Champagne and chocolates in our room upon arrival. The suite was gorgeous and very clean and I really enjoyed the Spa bathroom every day. The premises are beautiful and the food, whether room service or at the restaurant are excellent-the breakfast was amazing! They made restaurant and wine tasting reservations for us and most tastings were complimentary. Yountville is the best town to stay in Napa because all of the amazing restaurants are within walking distance; French Laundry, Bouchon, Bottega, and their bakery. We ate at all except French Luandry and they were all excellent; we really enjoyed walking to the bakery when they opened and eating their croissants and pastries...a very enjoyable expererience. Please try the following vineyards: Opus One, Domaine Chandon ( had so much fun doing a reserve tasting), Cakebread, Rombauer...Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room and lovely staff!”
Reviews.Author: jzme
Reviews.Content: My guy and I and BFF and her boyfriend stayed in 2 rooms for just one night in February. We got a "locals" rate which would have given us a ADA accessible room, however the hotel upgraded us before we even arrived. The rooms are nicely decorated and cozy, love the fireplace and high ceilings! It was raining while we were there but, no fear, there were umbrellas in the closet. This lovely hotel is an easy walk to downtown Yountville and close to the restaurant we ate at, REDD....YUM!!! Two words...butterscotch pudding! The hotel amenities were luxurious, the staff very personal and helpful. The bartenders (sorry can't remember their names...guy in the day and a lady at night, night of the Oscars) were so friendly and helpful with suggestions. We were celebrating my birthday and, upon arrival, there was a knock on our door with a complimentary bottle of Pinot, a delicious plate of bite size chocolate goodies and a hand written birthday card!!! How lovely is that? We had so much fun sitting by the fire sharing the wine and chocolates, very nice touch! Thanks Hotel Yountville!!! The only minor downsides were that the patio was not very private, could have use more ivy or bamboo as a privacy cover. The insulation between the rooms was not great...could hear our neighbors talking. Minor glitch with payment, my BFF had reserved the rooms on her CC and when we got there my guy put his card down as payment for our room. She ended up getting charged for both and he got charged zero. Check in the mail to her though, so I'm over it. I highly recommend this hotel and Yountville in general as a romantic, fun, relaxing getaway!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: peggy2357
Reviews.Content: This is everything a hotel should be. We stayed for our anniversary and were upgraded to a beautiful room. The staff were exceptional, helpful, and friendly. The room itself was large and comfortable, and the bathroom was a dream. We took lots of photos and hope to do something similar when we remodel our own bathroom. They thought of every need from umbrellas and robes, to a Keurig coffeemaker in the room. Others have mentioned noise from the next room, but we did not experience this. You can bike over to Domaine Chandon ! We cannot wait to come back. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: lac555
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this property several times in the past when it was the Yountville Inn. The last time we stayed there the hotel was worn and in need of updating. We are happy to say the hotel underwent an extensive renovation and reopened last year as Hotel Yountville. Service - For starters, when we arrived at the hotel on a busy holiday weekend, we found out that our reservation had been cancelled in error. After a little bit of research, they found the issue and were able to for our reservation. Thank you Melody!!! This could have been, and I am sure at many hotels would have been, a very bad situation. Also on the service side, Melody asked us about our plans. We have been to the valley several times and always seek out new wineries. While not wine geeks, we are serious about or wine and consider these visits shopping trips to locate wines and wineries we we cannot get at home. While we had a few wine tastings planned, Melody made some recommendations based on what we told her we were looking for. She made some calls and was able to schedule us in to some great wineries on short notice. Rooms - We had a king room on the lower floor. The room had a gas fire place, separate seating area, and large bathroom with jacuzzi tub and separate shower. The room was very clean with service twice per day. The bed and pillows were very comfortable, and the seating area with love seat and chair was nice for relaxing after a day of tasting. The balcony had two chairs overlooking a creek. Some reviewers have complained about the trailer park behind the hotel. If you re on the upper floor with a balcony, I could understand that as you would be overlooking the park. Of course if you look over that you see the mountains. Yountville is growing and some day the park will be replaced by large homes or a hotel, in that case the trailer park may not be bad as you still get the mountain views. The downside of the lower floor is that there is a walking trail that goes by the patios. There are shrubs between and I did not think that was a big deal. My only complaints would be 1) I wish there was a double vanity in the bathroom instead of the single. the bathroom is large enough and the renovation is recent, not sure why only a single, 2) The A/C unit is a single unit blowing right on the bed. I hate these units as it always seems to be too hot or cold, and the unit blowed on you in bed. Again, as a new renovation, these should have central air, or, at a minimum, not have the a/c near the bed, 3) the walls and ceilings are not very soundproof. Common in many places, but again, should have been addressed in the renovation. Facilities - There is a very nice pool area with a hot tub. We did not use it but it looked very nice and comfortable. There is also a spa which we did not use so cannot comment on. There is a small resent that is only open for breakfast. The food and service was great. I only wish it was open later in the day for sandwiches, salads, pizza, etc. After a day of tasting, that would have been nice. Overall, I use the term great value because it is when compared to other places in Yountville. It may not have a famous restaurant, spa, or tennis courts, but that is fine with me. I prefer it like this. The location is excellent as you can walk to some of the best restaurants in the valley. additionally, several tasting rooms have opened in Yountville so you can walk to tastings if you want. While there are a few things I would like different, I still rate as excellent and will definitely stay here again. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Romantic”
Reviews.Author: dheronimus
Reviews.Content: Simply loved the room with fireplace, four poster bed, and great bathroom (huge shower and jacuzzi tub). The staff were all very helpful and nice. The terrace is a great place to relax and have a drink. The only reason I didn't give this hotel an Excellent rating was because the walls are very thin and we could hear everything that was being said in the room next to ours.

Reviews.Title: “What a great stay”
Reviews.Author: solofilm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to celebrate with 10 of our friends to Napa our birthdays. I you are looking for a romantic getaway combined with celebrating with a bigger group of friends and event, hotel Yountville has it all. We rented one bedroom, very beautiful, with our own private deck. Besides an amazing, classy space with high quality service, we we also able to invite our friends for a glass of wine before heading out for dinner. Great pool, great spa, great breakfast dining, and the hotel lobby is very comfortable to meet everyone as well. We are definitely coming back. Thank you, staff!

Reviews.Title: “Pampered”
Reviews.Author: SSViaje
Reviews.Content: Hubbie and I were delighted from the start with Hotel Yountville. We were greeted with an upgrade to a lovely room with fireplace, jacuzzi, balcony... Everything was pristine and clean. Our only mistake: Next time we will start our vacation in San Fran & end in Yountville because it was hard to go from spacious Hotel Yountville to a city hotel room that was smaller than our bathroom in Yountville. (Truly!)

Reviews.Title: “A perfect escape”
Reviews.Author: The_Chevalier
Reviews.Content: At the center of Yountville, the heart of Napa Vally. Beautiful rooms (go for the Superior - it's worth it), quiet and relaxing atmosphere. A great place for a romantic vacation or touring the wine country.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, Romantic, Elite”
Reviews.Author: Kent M
Reviews.Content: Expensive...BUT WORTH IT ! This place is fabulous. 5 star Room, Great beds and bedding. The bathroom is one of the best I have been. The grounds are immaculate. The staff is responsive. Yountville is a great place to stay in Napa Valley. Our patio overlooked a creek.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect balance of personal, small and gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: Salon
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We loved the fire pits, the pool, the bar, the room - the bathroom! The bed was super comfortable, the bathroom with the luggage storage area and makeup table was well thought out and appreciated. We loved walking to all the restaurants (Redd was our favourite). I understand that some people might think there needs to be a dinner restaurant (and I think they should consider holding special wine dinners in their gorgeous breakfast dining room) and the view over the houses behind isn't the greatest - but look beyond that to the hills, the lovely service and the stunning facilities they do have. Greatly enjoyed. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy with level of service”
Reviews.Author: Debbiepez
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed here two nights. The rooms are gorgeous and we were even more excited about our romantic weekend upon seeing the room. Well, first night we were awakened multiple times by a crying, SCREAMING infant. At 6am, after the 4th time, I called the front desk. Her response was, I wish you would have called during the night. Understanding, this wasn't the hotel's fault I made one request. I asked if the people in the room could either be moved or us. They told us the people on either side were checking out and that it wouldn't happen again. That night, we realized The clerk had lied because we discovered another party we knew was in the room next to us and they do t have a baby. We were concerned but had a party to attend and did notarized back until 11pm. Once again, crying baby. We complained upon checkout. Keep in mind, nt only were they foolish enough to put a family with an infant next to a couple on a romantic getaway, they LIED by telling us they were checking out. They gave us a $150 credit which is quite frankly insulting for the loss of two nights sleep. I don't believe the entire stay should have been refunded but probably one full night. Although the facility was beautiful, some additional thought needs to be put into guest placement. Also,don't lie to your guests. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but could use some more amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Nathani
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel is beautiful. The rooms are modern and very comfortable with spacious bathrooms and fireplaces. The location is also awesome. The only complaint that I have is the lack of a true concierge. The front desk staff can be helpful, but it was a little difficult to get assistance booking wine tastings or restaurant reservations. In addition, there are generally not very many front desk staff and bellman to assist.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: FoxyFoodFan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Yountville a few days before Christmas and we absolutely loved it! First of all, the hotel gave us a room upgrade which was a real treat, an early Christmas present! The room was beautiful, tasteful, upscale yet comfortable, modern but not cold. In fact, I took several pictures of the room so I could use some of the ideas to incorporate into my home. Our room was located on the ground floor but we couldn't hear any noise from upstairs or the room next to us. Parking, which is complimentary, is not a parking deck or a spacious parking lot. Patrons park right outside their room door. A very nice touch. The location is stellar. We would walk to Bouchon Bakery for coffee in the morning, then in the evening, we walked a couple blocks for dinner. For the amenities, location, ambience and decor, Hotel Yountville is a great deal. There are many other pricier hotels that are far inferior. The only complaint is there is no gym on the premises. I realize a trip to Napa Valley should be leisurely and relaxing, but a girl's gotta burn off some calories consumed during wine tasting and indulgent dinners, right?!?

Reviews.Title: “fantastic birthday”
Reviews.Author: Christopher K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a night at this hotel for a birthday getaway, leaving the kids with grandma. We had one of the best getaways ever in our 20 year relationship. The hotel staff gave us the VIP treatment all the way (upgrade, champagne, chocolate, etc.). The room was beautifully rennovated with all the amenities. The pool and hottub were really, really nice after a day and night of wining and dining. The bikes they provided were fun and convenient for getting around and exploring this quaint little town. Finally, the breakfast was superb (not included, but reasonably priced). We can't wait to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Truly Great Service”
Reviews.Author: bteitel
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently stayed at Hotel Yountville. We stayed in a King Deluxe, and the room was beautiful. The decor was elegant, the type of stuff I would put in my own home. The weather was a bit chilly during the weekend, so we even got some nice use out of the fireplace. The staff was really great. Each member of the staff went above and beyond when called upon. Peter, one of the front desk staff, took it upon himself to call several wineries for us, and craft an afternoon of tastings for us. These guys really knew their stuff when it came to all things Napa Valley. The property is very large, and there are fireplaces and sitting areas everywhere. The pool was awesome - heated pool, jacuzzi, fire pit. truly a beautiful property, and the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great renovation but still a few kinks to work out”
Reviews.Author: kevincanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before the renovation and recently after it was done. Everything is beautiful. However there are a few minor kinks which were aggravating. The walls are thin and if you have a loud neighbor you can hear everything. If you cant fall asleep that easily like me than it will drive you crazy. I talked to the hotel about this and they said they had heard this complaint before and are working on fixing it. The beds were a little firm and the pillows large and not correct for the bed. These are the only problems I had othewise everything was great. The pool is georgeous and the Restaurant was very good though somewhat limited. All of the staff were great.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous renovation!! Fabulous Service!”
Reviews.Author: Msk6261
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about the new Hotel Yountville. Having stayed at the Yountville Inn many years ago, I would never have expected the caliber of hotel that they have now created! Service was outstanding! Friendly, warm, helpful and approachable! They spared no expense in the remodel and the rooms/bathrooms are exquisitely appointed. Top quality linens and towels. Extremely comfortable bed. Extra quiet, solidly constructed rooms. They offer bikes and accessibility to many wonderful wineries which, even though we visit Napa often, we had never tried. Walking distance to so many wonderful restaurants! The breakfast was fabulous too! And free wifi to boot!! I hate to gush but we have stayed in SO many, not worthy accommodations in the area. We live about an hour away and go to Napa often for a quick get away. We only stayed one night this trip but I think we have found our new go-to place in the Valley.

Reviews.Title: “very nice rooms and pool area”
Reviews.Author: LagunaBeachTraveler
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 2 nights in a larger, nicely appointed 2nd floor room which was an upgrade. the hotel is in proximity to the highway and traffic can be heard. the view from the balcony is of the mobil home park with mountains in the background. while this is a negative the room itself was very comfortable and made us extend our stay to a second night. the pool area is nicely appointed and clean. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: VABlue
Reviews.Content: Excellent rooms, great service (especially the bartender who made us feel at home), great location. Will make this the hotel of choice in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: HighWycombeMIch
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic place. We stayed in a one bedroom suite, which was certainly luxurious and spacious, with a fabulous bathroom. The pool and spa area were equally beautiful. It's extremely difficult to say anything else apart from WOW! A truly marvellous place.

Reviews.Title: “Rustic charm meets modern comfort”
Reviews.Author: kjwardakee
Reviews.Content: We checked out this morning, and my only regret is that we didn't stay longer. The grounds of Hotel Yountville are wonderful, and the rooms are beautifully decorated and perfectly appointed -- vaulted ceilings with exposed beams, stone-front fireplace, balcony, whirlpool tub, etc. The service, however, is this hotel's best asset. From the bellhop to the front desk to the servers at Hopper Creek Kitchen, we were assisted by friendly, helpful staff, offering turn-down service and the complimentary use of iPads. I only wish that we'd had time to take advantage of their bicycles, the spa, and inviting hot tub. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Napa and Sonoma in November”
Reviews.Author: einnoC
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms at this hotel: one was a bit larger since my daughter and her husband have a infant. Even though our room was slightly smaller it had a fireplace also with a separate walk- in closet area and lovely bathroom. I definitely would book our room again. The beds were extremely comfortable. There is an on site restaurant which served gourmet breakfasts. My only suggestion was to offer high chairs in the restaurant since cribs are offered in the rooms. This hotel is very convenient. We walked to Ad Hoc (Thomas Keller) and easily could have walked all through town. The weather was in the 50's and 60's during the day so we did not use the gas fireplace for very long. It puts out a lot of heat. There is also a ceiling fan and air conditioner if necessary. The pool area was gorgeous. We did not use the spa/massage facilities because they were very expensive. We had flown into SFO, visited several wineries and had lunch in Napa. Staying in Yountville was a convenient location for also seeing some wineries in Sonoma county. We only had four days in the area and wished for maybe two more. There was not enough time to check out the shops. I do not have photos to show the hotel but we were fortunate to see the changing of the leaves last week. They were brilliant reds and oranges.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Renovations”
Reviews.Author: kod
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay and the hotel was good 4 years ago but now is great in most ways. The outdoor pool and hot tub is new and in such a beautiful setting with wonderful landscaping and chairs. I pool was heated to at least 82 degrees and I swam laps every morning. Guests congregated in the hot tub with a surrounding fire pit every evening sipping their purchases and socializing. We had their basic room which was completely redone with a fireplace, walk in closet, and wonderful bathroom with a large jacuzzi tub and shower. The 4 poster king beds were so very comfortable with soft linens. The housekeepers, maintenance staff all had nice smiles and a friendly attitude, I found the front desk personnel to be friendly but you had to engage them first. My only suggestion is that it would have been helpful to have a dedicated concierge who was knowledgeable about the wineries and wines, as well as dinner suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we booked more than one night”
Reviews.Author: AmandaPK
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful overnight at Hotel Yountville. Can't complain at all. The rooms are very comfortable and well appointed. Staff is friendly and helpful, especially for Napa newcomers. The location was convenient. We also had a very memorable breakfast at the hotel restaurant. Highly recommended. All in all, it felt like a good deal for the area considering the range of accommodations and prices. If only we'd stayed longer...

Reviews.Title: “Big Expensive Let Down....”
Reviews.Author: Didi513
Reviews.Content: Upon making our reservation over 4 months prior to our stay, i had done research and also spoke to hotel personnel. The room placement is KEY at this place. I requested an upstairs suite away with a balcony - even thought they did not guarantee it - they said it was so far in advance they would likely accomodate our request, and it was a 10 year anniversary trip. We arrived, after a long flight, and upon arrival, the hotel was lovely looking, lobby, etc. We were escorted to our room - which was a lower level room. The room itself was nice, however the outdoor space patio was about 20 feet from a trailer park with rusted tin roofs, and a dog walking trail that did not belong to the hotel in which people walked by each morning and allowed their dogs to relieve themselves practically on our patio. It was gross. No privacy was the least of our worries. We had to keep the blinds completely drawn the entire time because of the view and all the people and dogs walking by at all times of day - so it was like being in a dungeon. We told them on day one we wanted to move, and the folks at the front desk were nothing short of rude - they had nothing available, and said they may be able to move us the next day (we were there 4 nights) - after the 3rd day, when they had not even contacted us - we called them and they said, oh yes - we can move you upstairs, it was our last night at this point, and it was a much nicer point of view, but unfortunately too little too late. They never mentioned our anniversary which somewhat burned me - when you go to a Ritz or Four Seasons for a special occasion, they greet you with a message and usually have at least a little handwritten card in your room upon check in. These people were cold. AS for the price - nearly $550 a night - they have a nerve - with a view of the trailer park!!! Not one mention of a discount, nothing....see ya was what we got at the check out....I will say that the pool was beautiful, the food (we only had bfast) at the restaraunt was fabulous, but between the trailer park, noise from the freeway, and all the construction going on, NOT WORTH THE $$$$ - or the attitude!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay when visiting Napa”
Reviews.Author: CaliCab
Reviews.Content: You really can't go wrong with the location. You are right where you want to be when visiting Napa. The only thing I could knock about Hotel Yountville is that the rooms on the north side of the property back up to an unsightly neighborhood. So staying on the second floor gives you a view of trailers, and they get a view of you. But the rooms are large and nicely done, and you aren't spending a lot of time on your back porch anyway. I would recommend this place to anybody that can afford it. Bartender was great when having a nightcap after coming back from dinner each evening.

Reviews.Title: “"Wow factor here for sure....."”
Reviews.Author: tripsbeus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Yountville in October 2011 in a Premium Room. It was well worth the relatively high price. The rooms are very large, well decorated and well appointed. The grounds are pristine. Pool area, bar and outdoor fireplace are awesome. Bartender was friendly and knowledgeable. The restaurant for breakfast was very good. The location in Yountville is excellent. Walking distance to shopping and great restaurants. A good central location for the Napa experience. We will stay there again and will recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: RobinSherwood
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th consecutive annual trip to Napa. The first stay at this hotel for us. It's remodeled and beautiful. Love the rooms, lobby, restaurant, pool and grounds. It's so close to all the wonderful restaurants and such in Yountville. Walk to everywhere - like Redd, Ad Hoc and so on. The staff here is professional, gracious and friendly, and super helpful. Our room was on the top floor. We had an end unit with a deck. The room was so nice. Breathtaking. Wonderful amenties and layout. A beautiful stone fireplace. Great bed and other furniture. A nice coffeemaker and refrigerator too. We had no neighbors the first few nights, so super quiet, except for some odd piped in music that was playing outside. It was a little bothersome on one evening/morning. We didn't notice the music the last night of our stay. However, by then we had neighbors next door including a crying baby. The walls must be thin. Regardless, I would stay here again. Love it.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Chic”
Reviews.Author: julias
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Yountville in mid-October. It is a boutique hotel that suits the Yountville area. The rooms and bathrooms are very nicely appointed with good attention to detail. Our room had vaulted ceilings and a fireplace with a cozy sitting area. Pretty much, everything is well represented by the hotel website photo gallery. The breakfast restaurant is amazingly good and only available to hotel guests. The pancakes were delicious, and the mushroom omelet was also very good. The bar in the lobby and outdoor sitting area with the fire pit are very inviting. (Though the bartender could use a little more training.) The hotel location is ideal, as you can walk to great restaurants like Bottega and Bouchon. The only criticism is that the thermostat didn't regulate the room temperature that well, and the air conditioner was a little loud. Didn't try the pool and hot tub, but they also looked nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lnd85266
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel, the location is perfect. We thought the front desk and the service in general was wonderful, everyone was very nice.The rooms are nicely appointed and the bed was very comfortable. We had a room in building 9, which faces the trailer park, which just felt odd facing that but for how often we were in the room, it's fine. My two problems were that the air conditioning unit is loud, we also had a room on the bottom floor and could hear everything upstairs which is so irritating after a while, so we didn't get the best night sleep, and after 5 nights I was ready to leave. Overall I would go back but get a room upstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: Persephone20
Reviews.Content: The accommodation and surroundings of the hotel are excellent. The room - even the most basic which is not a t all basic - is very luxurious, large and comfortable. The bathroom was also one of the best we have seen. There was a lovely patio with table and chairs - just right for enjoying some of that napa Valley wine. The pool area is also super and both the pool and jacuzzi are a really good size. The Hopper Creek restaurant is beautifully furnished and the breakfasts we had were excellent. The location of the hotel is great for experiencing all the restaurants in Yountville - they are all with in very easy walking distance. My big complaint about the hotel and the reason I haven't marked it excellent is the attitude of the staff especially at reception and in the restaurant. We found them arrogant. There were of course exceptions but on the whole they treated you with a coolness which was not pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of noises in a beautiful setting.”
Reviews.Author: MakeMyBed
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our friends through Napa and stayed at the Hotel Yountville for two nights . The town, the surroundings and the setting of the hotel are absolutely gorgeous. Our room was on the ground floor facing the back and facing a trailer park.We were awoken at 6.30 by the garbage truck coming by. Our friend's room was also on the ground floor , they had a bigger room with a cathedral ceiling and their room faced the front street, their room was noisy because of the road being so close by, our friends heard trucks all night. The walls of the rooms are VERY THIN, we could hear the TV from the room next to us and people walking above us. We could also hear the showers and the flushing toilets from all the neighbors. It seems that all the remodeled hotels nowadays have the louvre doors above the bath tub facing the bedroom, this hotel is no exception, there was no door for the bathroom plus they had mirrors everywhere so their is absolutely no privacy, good thing we have been married for a long time as I can not imagine being there on my first romantic date. The toilet door is more or less non existing, it is a sliding louvre door on rollers that doesn't close and let's out all the noise, not very romantic. The hotel does offer bikes for the guests and that was GREAT, we had a nice bike ride through town. The beds were comfortable, the prices are too high for this kind of a room. This is not a hotel I would go back to but I did love the town and will come back to Yountville.

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury”
Reviews.Author: andymanc10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night earlier this month and loved it. The room was huge, the spa was excellent and the staff were great. It is worth taking advantage of the free bikes and going for a cycle.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Debblues
Reviews.Content: Loved the room, the service, the breakfast in the restaurant was delish. Try the "Duck n Donuts" it's a must have. The room was spacious with a very relaxing jet tub. icamt say anything wrong about my stay expect for...I didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: global_traveler28
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Yountville for 5 nights. The rooms were amazing and the staff is very helpful and accommodating. Only two drawbacks: 1) They don't have room service, however, the staff was willing to pick up food for us from a few places in town which was going above and beyond. 2) the bathroom was open and only had a sliding door for the toilet - you could hear everything. I had contacted the concierge before we got there and she booked all our restaurants, events, and wineries before we got there. She was extremely helpful and everything was perfect! I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: cherabeara
Reviews.Content: Clean, spacious room with charming amenities i.e. fireplace, vaulted ceiling, large bathroom with oversize tub. The balcony is shaded by mature trees and although you're in the middle of town, you feel 100 miles away. The bed was so comfy, I never wanted to leave. Staff was friendly and welcoming. Looking forward to going back soon!

Reviews.Title: “THEIR WEBSITE IS BETTER”
Reviews.Author: cjimci
Reviews.Content: The problem with reading reviews is that they are subjective; based on the writer's personal experience and perceptions. With that in mind, I submit that the Hotel Yountville is not at all what it appears to be. I'm not sure what the other reviewers saw, but the hotel is located between a 55+ housing development and a trailer park. It faces the highway, which can be easily heard while at the pool. The hotel was recently renovated and I'm sure a great deal of money was invested. The furniture and finishes are very upscale. But, the room design is absolutely the most dysfunctional we have ever seen. Our closet was small and the clothes bar placed so low that we hung most of our clothes on the four poster bed and the thermostat. Handles were never installed on the two drawers of the only dresser in the room. To use it, we had to kneel on the floor and squeeze our hands under the bottom drawer and push it open from the back. I don't think that's how its done at the Ritz Carlton. It was easier to leave our clothes folded on the sofa and chairs. The bathroom door is on rollers and lacks a latch or lock, and it rolls open as soon as its closed. The staff, while friendly, seem detached and forgetful. We asked for hangers twice but received none. We asked about having handles installed on the dresser, but none were. At the end of our stay, I showed the desk manager how we had been living; dresses and suits hanging from the bed rails, shirts and shorts folded on the sofa; bedroom slippers holding doors closed and drawers open. I think he might have been concerned, but I can't be sure. I would think twice about staying here again - even though they had one of the nicest and most professional bartenders we have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BRWCEW
Reviews.Content: What a great experience. The room was fantastic and the service was great. The restaurant is only open for breakfast, but that was fantastic also. We are definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Jrankin
Reviews.Content: This recently redone property gets it right in so many ways, with a great mix of aesthetics and comfort. The lobby is very soothing, and the outdoor fireplace lounge and pool areas are almost movie set-perfect. The restaurant was charming, and the breakfast we had there was great. The most pleasing surprise was our room. While not inexpensive, it was not one of the most pricey either, and it was really lovely. Our two double bed-room was on the ground floor with a patio facing the (dry in August) Hopper Creek with seating for 6 - a beautiful spot for AM coffee or a nightcap. Inside, we had high beamed ceilings, a rock fireplace and pleanty of space to spread out. I agree with the other reviewers, though, the service does not seem to be quite as sophisticated as the ambiance. Maybe they just need a few more people - the front desk seemed slightly understaffed, the pool service a bit slow, and the bar not open at times when you might think it should be. All in all, however, a great stay and I would definitely reccommend to even the most discerning traveller!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in Napa, don't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: 1ABCReviewer
Reviews.Content: We were worried that being in the heart of yountville and close to the highway, this hotel would seem noisy or feel like being in the middle of a town - there was no need to worry! By the pool you could be anywhere, it's very relaxing, very stylish, and good food/drink service The rooms are great, go for one by the creek as they will be very quiet. Very clean, stylish, couldnt ask for more. No need to stay anywhere else in napa

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Newyorkenthusiastic
Reviews.Content: Hotel Yountville is a top notch hotel. The rooms are exactly as they appear on the website; impeccably clean, decorated with high-end taste and the pool area is spectacular. We will definitely return. The staff is extremely professional and there to please. Upon arrival, you will receive a list of wineries that offer complimentary tastings to the guests of the hotel. The reception will make the appointment for you and in many instances the tasting is private. We enjoyed are stay tremendously and extended it an extra night. There are no cons except that breakfast is not included but coffee is served in the lobby every morning and each room comes equipped with a Krueger coffee maker.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resort but second class service”
Reviews.Author: HRP06
Reviews.Content: At the outset let me just say that the hotel itself is located in a wonderful location to explore Napa, and the renovations performed to the hotel were wonderful. The rooms were opulent, and the pool area was fantastic. It may just be my experience, but the level of service provided by the hotel staff is not up to scratch when you compare it to the quality of the hotel and the prices being charged. When you pay top dollar, you expect top dollar service - and unfortunately this is not what was received. The first hour spent at the hotel included - an exceptionally loud employee on the phone at reception which made it difficult to check-in, no bar staff at the pool for the first 30 minutes after we arrived such that we could not order a drink, when the drink was finally obtained it came in a scratched glass covered in water (it must have just been taken from the dishwasher).... and the list goes on. A whole host of little things just seemed to be missing or went wrong that just added up. Don't get me wrong, this hotel had amazing potential - but my experience was not anything above average.

Reviews.Title: “What a hidden oasis after days with beauty and fine wine”
Reviews.Author: gowilton
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in the afternoon and where quickly checked in and given room keys - upon opening the door what a lovely treat - room 806 on the second floor high ceilings and a nicely appointed room - a beautiful bed, gas fireplace and a bathroom that makes you want to stay in it for hours. The balcony was good - although not a great view on the creek side as the creek is dry this time of year. Fantastic shower and tub - enjoyed the room tremendously - have breakfast in the restaurant - perfect eggs and the breakfast risotto - yum! The pool is great as well. We were impressed. The only drawback - the blinds don't keep out the early morning sun - so if you are an early riser keep your eyes closed! Front desk service is fine - not over the top but loved the property so much didn't mind.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Domenique8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just celebrated our anniversary at the Hotel Yountville and we had a wonderful experience. The room was spacious, beautifully decorated and clean. We especially loved the fireplace, spa tub and the romantic four poster bed. The property is so quiet and sophisticated, perfect for couples. I would not bring our child here. In fact, we only noticed couples during our four night stay. Great place for a romantic getaway. The pool and outdoor lounging area were quite lovely and we received excellent service from the hotel restaurant server while we were enjoying the double sized lounges arond the pool. The crushed glass fire element by the whirlpool was very inviting at dusk or right after dinner. The hotel's Hopper Creek restaurant was delicious for breakfast. The brioche French toast and strawberries with Saba were incredible. We had such a lovely time, that we are recommending the hotel to all of our friends who love the Napa Valley. And it is definitely the only place we will stay. We are already planning to come back in a few months for the crush! The couples experience spa treatment at the on site spa was wonderful and the spa staff were very welcoming, friendly and informative.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property - nearly there”
Reviews.Author: Welshjon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel twice in a week - initial stay was for 3 nights then after 3 cold and foggy days in San Francisco headed back to Yountville for the last night of our holiday. We stayed in a Deluxe room (the hotel's standard room) and as per other reviews these are some of the best decorated rooms we have ever stayed in. However, on our first visit we were in the upstairs middle room of block 3 (room 306 or 307?) and you could hear every word, cough, sneeze etc from the rooms on either side. Unacceptable in a hotel like this - and very surprising - it was almost to the point where you felt sound was being amplified into the room - very strange. We didn't have neighbours for the 2nd and 3rd nights so the problem went away. Surprised this is not mentioned more on this site. We stayed mid week and the hotel was quite quiet, and staff were not particularly welcoming. Pool service was also poor and generally it made for quite a strange experience as the property itself is outstanding and unlike most lives up to the images on the website. They also don't have a licence for the bar in the lobby (although that wasn't mentioned to us) but are serving drinks at the pool. Not sure of timescales but the licence is applied for so it is only a matter of time. On the second visit we were in a different room - upstairs corner room in block 9 - fantastic room - including a balcony - oversized bathroom - without doubt the best room of our trip (which included the Wynn, Beverly Wilshire etc). We arrived at midday on Sunday, were checked in immediately, the hotel was busy, reception staff more on their game and there was an excellent and very hard working guy at the pool - 'Tom' - who provided outstanding service. If this had been our only experience of the hotel we would have had no criticisms and were very glad we returned for one more night. Pool area is beautiful - excellent, very comfortable double loungers (with individually adjustable mattresses) and when Tom is working, great service. Also good at night when the fire pit is on for a dip in the jacuzzi. Overall a great property, superbly remodelled with excellent attention to detail and top quality fixtures and fittings - just a few tweeks mainly to the staff (and sound proofing) would make it perfect. Yountville itself is a great little town - we ate in Mustards (ok but on the night we were there very hard to understand the hype - food very average), Bouchon (terrible service, staff couldn't cope, poor food - much better options available all around) and the Farmstead Restaurant at Long Meadow Ranch which was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Astonishing Transformation of an Old Favorite”
Reviews.Author: Pelhamgirl
Reviews.Content: Yountville is a little treasure of a town near Napa which contains some of the best restaurants and hotels in America. Hotel Yountville, though a rustic, low-key favorite over the years, has been remodeled into a truly sophistocated, Tuscan-influenced resort. The greeting at the lobby, the efficient and personal transporation to your room, the restful rooms with every corner designed to please your eye, the stunning pool and helpful staff will make your visit worth every dollar! This is a place not for children or loud, badly-mannered families. This is a place for romance, relaxation, quiet, and the planning of your gastronomic adventures at Ad Hoc, Redd, The French Laundry, and the best of all of them, Bistro Jeanty. Do not miss this astonishing place.

Reviews.Title: “Just Marvelous”
Reviews.Author: Nella50
Reviews.Content: We went for my husbands 50 th birthday, and we had a great time. When we got to the hotel we were greeted by Martha the front desk clerk....she was great, very helpful and a fabulous personality. All I could say is, that it is a dream place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Property, Staff Needs Some Warmth”
Reviews.Author: Carmela W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at this Yountville property for 4 nights and had a really relaxing, wonderful experience. The property itself is very cozy and thanks to a renovation in 12/2010, the amenities are new and top of the line. We've stayed at properties in Yountville before and toured the newest Bardessono but felt Hotel Yountville was the the most cozy, spacious property with a beautiful pool and wonderful spa. Don't miss the unbelievable breakfast at Hopper Restaurant, the onsite dining facility. Each of our breakfasts had us coming back the next day for more...their croissants beat out Bouchon bakery! Our server Cesar was the highlight of the staff...he was warm, friendly, always accommodating, and looking for ways to make our stay comfortable! Our expectations were all met here but we do have one complaint and we're sorry that we didn't see a difference day to day as we spent 5 days on property. The front desk staff (with the exception of one gentleman) was absolutely cold, not receptive to our inquiries, and almost seemed bothered to welcome us. It was such a strange experience that we felt compelled to write about, hoping there will be changes in the future as it is a nice property.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS Hotel - Fabulous experience!”
Reviews.Author: CHBTX
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Yountville for 3 nights and we loved it! This will be our new Napa Valley (specifically Yountville) hotel of choice! Where do I begin. The hotel is beautiful, very clean and so charming. We were delighted to learn when we checked in that they upgraded our room. The service was great throughout the hotel - the staff was professional and very helpful. The room was beautiful and spotless. The bed was SO comfortable! The room included a very cool bathtub and fireplace - both added to the overall charm of the room. The pool area was so relaxing. The staff in the dining room was so nice and and provided great service. There are very cool relaxing places on the property where you can sit and enjoy a glass of wine or a cup of coffee - a very cool area near the lobby with an outdoor fireplace - so charming - and another great area near the pool. The hotel is conveniently located near all the GREAT restaurants in Yountville. If you are looking for a nice, quiet, relaxing getaway - look no further than Hotel Yountville.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great staff....”
Reviews.Author: kwermuth
Reviews.Content: I was planning a special trip for my boyfriend and connected with Melody Tandy at the Hotel Yountville who did a fabulous job in providing me assistance with a driver, wineries and some unique experiences to try while in Napa. She was informative, responsive and just a delight to work with. Once at the resort everyone we encountered was awesome and especially enjoyed Caesar in the restaurant who was awesome. The facilities are fantastic but the staff is what makes it so special. Truly a find in the Napa valley area.....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Anniversary Getaway!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sanders1700
Reviews.Content: Let me first start by stating that my husband and I travel quite a bit with our careers and when we travel for personal trips our expectations are extremely high. This was our first stay at Hotel Yountville and we will be back. The hotel and staff exceeded any and all expectations. The rooms are trendy, but charming with a warm, comfortable feeling. The amenities are 5 star and the restaurant, although small is fantastic. Our trip was a short weekend trip and I was able to coordinate and book all of our requested events with guest services. All of their recommendations were excellent and really made our trip memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish & swanky”
Reviews.Author: linlees
Reviews.Content: New hotel, great location in yountville. Some road noise as close to freeway, also blinds in room let sun through for an early morning call! Other than that nice hotel, great breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the rooms, will be back.”
Reviews.Author: DeluxeTraveler
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely double queen room. It was very large, comfortable for our family of three, and beautifully decorated. The room was newly redone and very clean. I think next time we may try and request a room that overlooks Hopper Creek. We did not have a chance to eat at the restaurant. We loved the location, with it being close to everything in the small town of Yountville. Very close to a small market to buy waters and snacks. Melody at the front desk was very helpful and welcoming. Our new favorite place to stay while visiting Napa Valley. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “After much research...great choice!”
Reviews.Author: 10SmomOf3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Yountville in May. We loved our stay! The rooms are large and very chic. There is an outdoor sitting area to enjoy your days purchase of wine. I was able to utilize the spa. I had a 90 minute massage that was heavenly. You have to eat at Hopper Creek Kitchen! Being a foodie, it was beyond my expectations. The one and only negative would be that I am a VERY fussy sleeper and was able to hear people talking next door. Other than that, it was very quiet. We were in the back along the river. I would come back and stay here next time in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SusanH98
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Yountville for three nights. I cannot say enough good things about it! The location is excellent--close walking distance to all the great restaurants and shops in downtown Yountville. We were booked in a regular king room, which was beautiful, but were quickly upgraded to a premium suite due to a dog barking in the next room non-stop. (They do not allow pets now, but our hotel neighbors had made their reservation with pet before the change.) Needless to say, we were thrilled with the new premium suite as well as the prompt service in getting us to a new (quieter!) room. We ate at the Hopper Creek Kitchen one morning for breakfast, and it was great. During our visit it was too cool to sit at the pool, but it is super nice! I am already dreaming of going back to Napa....mainly for the hotel, not the wine! :)

Reviews.Title: “excellent yountville resort”
Reviews.Author: RexKite
Reviews.Content: We went from calistoga to yountville, great change of environment, hotel yountville was PERFECT. Great large rooms, awesome chic look/feel, quick walk to all downtown restaurants! Bikes were high quality - ride north past town - into vineyards and delightful views. thanks!

Reviews.Title: “All around fabulous hotel, posh but laid back”
Reviews.Author: Ovansomeren
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel online, the pictures were accurate. Underwent a recent renovation. We stayed in a king suite, private balcony on second floor. Spacious, decorated to the nines. Nothing to complain about. Great location in downtown Yountville just steps away from adhoc restaurant. pool and hot tub are open late, great romantic ambiance a fire next to hot tub. Stayed on a Monday night, the place was very quiet, and we were given a complimentary upgrade. A+ for friendly service, great lounge area great location and great accommodations. We didn't use the spa or eat at their restaurant, but the spa , menu had a great selection of services. Great place for a couples get away, etc. We will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and spa.”
Reviews.Author: N6812T
Reviews.Content: This is the old Yountville Inn, but totally redone. The website photos are actually accurate in depicting what to expect. The spa was great, they did a good job. Hotel is very nice, particularly at the Tablet rate of 375. It'll go higher very soon, I'm sure. Location is super. Parking is very convenient, which is good given the boxes and boxes of wine one tends to carry to the room at the end of each day. Very nice property, rooms, design, the whole deal. The only downer was that they don't have their liquor license yet. Not that I care, being in wine country it's easy enough to bring your own. But I would have liked to have known that sooner. We got to the pool before our spa appointments, and thought "cocktail?" Nope. No dice. But that's not much of a condemnation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Amazing Staff, Amazing Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: CineBrent
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently visited the Hotel Yountville for our honeymoon. It was our first trip to wine country so we went with no idea of where things were in Napa. We had booked at a different hotel but I switched to Hotel Yountville having seen that most of the restaurants we wanted to have dinner at were within walking distance. This hotel was the highlight of our trip! We hope the rates stay reasonable, unlike the nearby hotels, so we can visit again soon! We had a premium room with a king bed and a nice size tub in the middle of the room (might seem odd at first, but it will grow on you quickly!). We found ourselves spending most nights inside with the fireplace on, watching a movie and drinking a bottle of wine. We also spent one night out at the fire pit near the pool. We did breakfast two times at the Hooper Creek Kitchen. It was the best breakfast we have ever had! We did the seasonal tasting menu and it was all tasty! The duck and doughnuts were very good as was the poached egg and french toast soufflé. The second time we asked them to bring the food to our room, they did not have room service at the time of our trip, but they were happy to accommodate us and brought our breakfast over in a nice basket. They went out of their way to make sure we had a great breakfast experience. The entire hotel staff is very friendly and eager to help! One staff member, Ephram, helped us on a few occasions and represented the hotel very well. The hotel is also partnered with a few local wineries. We took advantage of their partnership with Mondavi. The front desk was happy to book the tour and tasting for us and provided us with suggestions for other wineries in the area. A great tip for a quick, cheap lunch, go to the Yountville Deli, shares a parking lot with Bistro Jeanty (also amazing!). The sandwiches are better than Oakville Grocery and half the price!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and thoughtful”
Reviews.Author: judicioustravels
Reviews.Content: This was a special trip for my family and I wanted to find an equally special place to stay while in Napa. The search was exhausting and we finally settled on this hotel. THE BEST DECISION WE MADE! It's true that one person can make all the difference and for us, it was the hotel's "Melodie" from the front desk staff. It was like being greeted by family on our arrival and knowing it was a big trip for my parents, she went out of her way for them. It made our stay so warm and special. I wish every hotel had someone like her! In addition, the rooms are beautiful and scream "vacation!" You'll also want to enjoy the relaxing and stylish ambiance in the lobby, outside patio and pool. Breakfast room is lovely and the food is delicious. The hotel has thought of everything. While there is some light final touches being done on the hotel and it may be reflected in the price (since we thought we had a steal comparably to what we were seeing for similar prices in the area), it's hardly noticeable. Hotel management has thought of everything. This is a gem and I am already planning our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay while in napa”
Reviews.Author: SophieandGregg
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was very charming and the staff super friendly and helpful. Our room was big and everything was 5 star quality. We loved the decor bedding and design of our room. The restaurant was amazing, best breakfast. So many details and amazing service. You can walk to anywhere in town from this hotel. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay...”
Reviews.Author: Zeebs3
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this Hotel for a long weekend in March. Booked back in January and received a great rate compared to the other Hotels in Yountville. Check in was easy, our room was very nice, and the grounds are well manicured. The Hotel is going through a massive remodeling effort (was not aware of this until our arrival) and it's apparent some kinks are still being worked out. For example, the Hotel does not yet sell wine/alcohol, we attempted to purchase room service at 9:30pm and that was not available, most hotels offer a free breakfast - this is not the case here. Again, most of these minor concerns will probably be worked out over the next few weeks/months but it would have been nice to know prior to our stay. Overall, good experience - great location, can only get better!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelKell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in February while in town wine tasting. We researched SO many hotels throughout Napa and finally decided on Hotel Yountville. The Hotel was Beautiful. They are in still remodeling some of it but I never heard any noise from any of the work being done. We were in a brand new room that had only been open for a month. The room was huge with a beautiful fireplace and patio. The bathroom was also huge! I loved the shower!!! It was a very clean hotel in a great location Overall a great stay and we are already planning our trip back!

Reviews.Title: “Newly refurbished and looking good”
Reviews.Author: eccysteve
Reviews.Content: The builders were still in when we stayed, transforming this former "inn" into a luxury spa hotel. The new rooms are excellent - smartly kitted out and very comfortable and the new restaurant is good if pricey (we paid almost USD 50 for breakfast for 2). Beware if given a second floor room and you have a heavy suitcase, as there are no lifts, due to the motel like layout. Staff are slightly unhelpful and distant and the full room rate is expensive - however, if you can book at a good discount, as we did, it's a great place to stay. Well located for some of the best wineries in Napa and Yountville itself is a bustling upmarket, somewhat touristy town with some great places to eat and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful relaxing place”
Reviews.Author: rrapport
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems to be in the final stages of renovation and has tremendous potential. It was a very quiet early January weekend and there were very few guests. Our room was large, but cozy, with a vaulted ceiling, fireplace and jacuzzi tub in the bedroom. The decor was beautiful. The bathroom was also large. We got the feeling that we were the first guests to use the room after renovations. Everything was impeccable. The spa was peaceful and relaxing. The hotel was operating in a soft opening so the rates were a little more reasonable than the advertised standard rates. I'd have to say we saw the place in what was likely its worst possible light - overcast damp, cool and foggy weather, few guests and landscaping an d outdoor atrium still a work in process yet we still enjoyed it and will return. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant - there are too many good restaurants in the area - but the complimentary coffee and fresh chocolate croissants available in the lovely lobby at 6:00 am were a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Really beautiful hotel with fantastic food”
Reviews.Author: Sportsgirl59
Reviews.Content: Still under construction, but the staff was very accomodating

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay for all Napa visits”
Reviews.Author: mjadse
Reviews.Content: Although the Hotel Yountville (they changed the name from Yountville Inn on December 1) was still finishing up some of the details from a renovation project, I do not hesitate to give this hotel top ratings. If anyone complains about this hotel, especially the service, they are just not paying attention. From the moment we arrived, we were treated like highly respected family. Peter took care of us and all of our requests. He and other staff members went out of their way to make our stay memorable and fantastic. We stayed in one of the renovated rooms which was just beautiful. It has modern fixtures set in an old world environment including a beautiful stone fireplace. The appliances were chrome and contemporary and the furniture held the room together with a traditional charm. I loved the plush towels and soft plush rug when stepping out of the shower. They provide the high quality Gilchrist & Soames hair, skin, and body products in the bathrooms. I was pleasantly surprised at how quiet and peaceful it was and I slept well in the luxurious four-poster bed. I don't know what kind of thermostat system they use, but I never heard a fan or heater yet it remained a perfect temperature in our room. The new lobby furniture was just installed the day before we arrived and you can tell the interior designer is paying a lot of attention to detail. The furniture and decor looks very classy but also very comfortable-looking and inviting. It lives up to the phrase casual elegance. We will definitely stay at the Yountville Inn again. The location is perfect for walking to great restaurants (we went to French Laundry and Bottega Ristorante this trip), cute shops, and even wine tasting nearby. I look forward to seeing the completion of the spa and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: MEDCO7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Yountville Inn in October, 2010 and were very disappointed. The property is going through a big renovation but we were not compensated at all for the inconvenience this caused. Upon returning from the trip, several in our group discovered that we were double charged on our credit cards! It has been difficult to get the problem rectified since they do not call us back.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: persiantabib
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best relaxing Inn around the Napa valley. great place to stay , comfortable room. great service. great back yard with relaxing sitting outside area. walking distance to Major Yountville , downtwon restaurants and quite. This is a place to rest.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Great location and great accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: FairReviewerOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November 2009 and wanted to be back again now, in August or September 2010, but it looks like they are going through renovations and the property is closed temporarily.... unfortunately for us. We like to stay in Yountville. We consider this town to be the best location in Napa Valley. The restaurant selection is amazing and includes some of the top restaurants in California and the Country (French Laundry, Bouchon, Bottega, etc). The town is also very cute, colorful and green. Just what we want when in wine country. The Yountville Inn is right in the middle of it all, a few steps from everything in town and some of the best wineries in the valley. We stayed in an upgraded room (I believe the Deluxe) and comparing it to the pictures posted on this site, I believe we got one of the best rooms. The upgrade was definitely worth the extra money: corner unit on the second floor, extremely spacious, with king size bed, high wood-beam vaulted ceilings, very nice wide gas fireplace, and very nice spacious bathroom. I don't think we had a patio, but it was a chilly time in November and I might have ignored it. The King bed was huge and very comfortable. The fireplace was very nice and cozy. I moved the bench in front of it so I could lay by the fire and warm up on a cold and wet day. The bathroom was also very nice, super clean, and roomy. Continental breakfast was also pretty good, in the main communal room with some tables, lots of couches, and a big fireplace. Overall, very private, quiet, romantic, and a very good value for the cost: around $200 per night in the fall. We loved the Yountville Inn and hope that the renovations will only make it better. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “One of our Favorite Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Diane38953
Reviews.Content: This hotel is our favorite hotel not only in the Napa Valley, but just about anywhere else. The rooms are very spacious, quiet, and comfortable. The continental breakfast is excellent, too. We prefer staying in Yountville because you can walk to the best restaurants in the area and it is a convenient location to visit most wineries.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient”
Reviews.Author: RichardSoutheast
Reviews.Content: Stayed three days in a king superior room. Room was large and clean with fireplace, sofa, and patio overlooking a stream. There was patio furnature and a table with wine glasses - all came in handy. Two sinks in the bath - just like home. Nice towels. Breakfast was simple but nicely done. My only complaint was that the walls seem thin - we could hear conversations in adjacent rooms - if you get loud neighbors, this would be a deal breaker. The location is downtown next to great restaurants (we particulalry liked Redd for dinner and the Bouchon Bakery for lunch), so we could walk - convenient after a few wine tastings. We tend to visit the smaller premium family wineries and the Inn supplied us a comp tasting card which was well received wherever we went and an upfront cost savings. While this Inn was not our first choice in Yountville, we were very happy with it and will return. No fitness center, but brisk walks through downtown and vineyards make up for it. Internet was free (yeah!) but a bit slow.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Colleyville_traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a group for Valentine's Day weekend. We really enjoyed the hotel. The breakfast in the morning was not fancy but good. We enjoyed a wine tasting on Friday night in the lobby. We thought the hotel was very nice. My only complaint was that we could hear the people above us walking around. However, we will go back, as we enjoyed the hotel and the location. Also, they have discounts for tastings at various wineries, which can provide a pretty good savings.

Reviews.Title: “Napa area retreat”
Reviews.Author: AnneS3
Reviews.Content: Amazing rooms with cathedral ceilings and fireplace. Private patio with lounge chairs and wine tasting right in the lobby! Felt like coming home.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay ruined by paper-thin walls and loud neighbors”
Reviews.Author: lisaq42
Reviews.Content: Our first impression of Yountville Inn was very good. The location was great- walking distance to great restaurants like Ad Hoc and Hurley's. The reception was nice, the grounds were pretty and we were able to check in early. The room (101) itself was large and comfortable- it had a patio overlooking a creek. The amenities were excellent- there were robes in the closet and very nice soaps and shampoos. The room came had a set of wine glasses and bottle opener, and Starbucks for the coffeemaker. The king sized bed was comfortable and there was a small sitting area with a couch. We were very impressed on the quality of the accomodations for the price ($179) and even discussed returning in the summer. We loved that there were no neighbors above us, just one room to the side. Great! Peace and quiet right? Wrong! We were awoken at 7:30am on Sunday morning by the people in the next room. At first, I thought they were right outside our door, maybe packing the car to leave, but soon I realized that the voices we heard were from the next room over. We could make out every word they said- every word! There seemed to be 3 adults staying in the room, up early, chatting away with the TV on. And then the baby started crying. And wouldn't stop. Who brings an infant to the wine country?? The noise didn't stop until 10am when they checked out. They sounded like they were in the room with us. They even responded to me when they heard me complaining about how loud they were- they said they "didn't care"! I was too exhausted and frustrated to bother calling the front desk to complain- not that there was much to be done. I've travelled extensively from hostels to Hiltons and everything in between and these were the thinnest walls I've ever experienced. That's why I rated the hotel highly (it looked great) but also said I wouldn't recommend it (the noise). The early wake up ruined our trip completely which is a shame because the hotel is lovely. We were so tired from the early wake up that we simply left, too exhausted to even go to reception. And we won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and Predictable”
Reviews.Author: davidandrose1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 3 or 4 times previously, as we like walking to the many great restaurants in town. Their rates - if avoiding Friday or Saturday - are no different than staying in the Marriott or one of the other branded-chains closer to downtown Napa, and the hotel has some local charm, though construction for a large expansion take away from it a bit. Free breakfast, with pastries, fruit, bagels, hardboiled eggs, juice, cereals, yoghurt, are more than adequate, but we always end up walking to Bouchon bakery for some of the finest baked goods anywhere. Wifi is also free throughout the property. The rooms are comfortable, spacious and quiet, though the tvs are older and hard to see from the beds in some rooms, and the shower/tub setup is a little dark given how the surround is designed. We were told that the existing rooms will all be renovated once the expansion is complete in 2010. We'll continue to visit here during our trips to the Valley 1-2x a year, though we'll also continue exploring some of the other new hotels popping up around the region.

Reviews.Title: “Stuffy”
Reviews.Author: KKHWINE
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I have stayed at the Yountville Inn 3 times in 8 years and this time will be our last. Our stay and the service this time was very different than before. We arrived on a Thursday and departed on a Sunday. We have always stayed in a king superior prior but they were booked this time for Thursday/Friday. So we stayed in their Queen Superior for Thur/Fri and had reservations for a King Superior on Saturday. The QS was ok BUT the room was stuffed way off to the side next to construction with no windows and no screen on the patio so there was no air flow. Our friends stayed next to us in room 503 and had the same problem – couldn’t breathe. After a day of traveling and wine tours, I hopped into a bed that sank in the middle. When I returned to the front desk on Saturday to find out where our new room was moved to, I was told next to the one we were in. I said this wasn’t a king superior and had a reservation confirmation number to prove it.
