The lady at the front desk was nasty and unfriendly and most of all challenging and was insinuating I was a liar. I must say, I wasn’t any more pleasant since I had a confirmation letter in hand showing my reservation. They attempted to move us to a Queen Deluxe which is a huge down grade. All I have to say is this – Their inner rooms are nice – stay away from room numbers in the 500’s. They have King Superiors on the upper level which are nice and some of their rooms do have windows which is nice in the fall for sleeping. The provide 1 bottle of sparkling water and there isn’t any other water for purchase or a soda machine. They have really scaled down on their morning breakfast as well. They had bagels, yogurt, cereal and some not so good looking fruit. Needless to say, we walked across the street to the Villagio Inn (where we have stayed before and should have this time again) and was greeted with a free bottle of cold water and full breakfast buffet they serve to their guests. Would only recommend this hotel if they stayed in a King Superior OR Queen Superior not in room level 500

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced in an expensive Town”
Reviews.Author: julie5
Reviews.Content: Lets face it, Napa is an expensive destination these days. Yes, you can go for the day from the bay area but to really enjoy the wine country you need to stay over a night or two (or three). We choose the Yountville hotel for its location and price. It has an acceptable breakfast but the real bonus was the complimentary tasting card for numerous popular wineries (most for 2 people) that will save you a bundle. Staff was curtious but limited in knowledge. We knew more than they did which was dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant spot”
Reviews.Author: fuzzybennuti
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in September at the Yountville Inn to celebrate a birthday. This was our first time staying here but would return. the Inn is charming and our room was spacious with high ceilings which keeps you from getting that caged feeling after a few days at an Inn or hotel. We had a private little patio with 2 chairs and a small table which we used every evening as it was quite warm during the day but very pleasant in the evening to sit out. The room was very clean, the towels were large and fluffy and the bathroom area was very large with a lot of place to stow your belongings. The water was nice and hot and the shower had adequate pressure, which isn't always the case at some hotels now. In the morning they provide a light breakfast of pastry, yogurt, etc. and the breakfast room is very large with the tables nicely spaced apart. The people on duty were all helpful and friendly. They are planning an expansion with more rooms and more services which will be very nice. Our only complaint is that the bed was not very comfortable, which will probably be remedied in the update they are planning.

Reviews.Title: “Very good at current rate”
Reviews.Author: lipsticktraces
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends in what was listed as the "Run of House" rate/room. For one night at the current rate this was a good deal. We had a room with two queen beds, gas fire place, couch, small patio (off a dry creek), free parking, *slow*/easy to access wi-fi, and a nice breakfast (gourmet cheese/breads, instant oatmeal, tea/coffee, etc.). Construction noise started at 8am sharp -- which was not advertised until after we arrived. I would re-evaluate this stay in the following weeks as determined by the construction and current economy/local pricing. If you are only evaluating by convenience to local wineries/restaurants, this is a very good spot.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Place to Stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: msa1164
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th stay at Yountville Inn. It has an amazing charm and character. We always book a deluxe room - love the room size and bedding. It is pricy, but you get what you pay for. The morning buffet is simply the best we have encountered - breads, bagels, cheeses, fruit, etc. Being a Floridian, my wife loves the fireplace... in the winter... Each and every time, this place exceeds our expectations. It is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: sharknes
Reviews.Content: This is a great cozy place, just a couple minutes away from the great restaurants in Yountville. The staff is not overly outgoing or friendly but everything else was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorites”
Reviews.Author: nikkiey
Reviews.Content: I love the Yountville Inn--would happily stay here anytime in Napa. Especially wonderful if you book within their last minute rate specials--usually half price (around $150)...but would be great full price too. Huge rooms, the pool is perfect, small but intimate and quiet. Everything is nice without feeling fussy or pretentious. We stay here whenever in Napa and after staying at a few other spots, find this is the best. Plus the included breakfast is superb--delicious delicacies and pastries...yum!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and great location”
Reviews.Author: Maria35
Reviews.Content: This was a great find for Napa Valley. We got a great price. The room was huge, comfortable, wireless worked. Complimentary breakfast really good. Wine tasting one night. Quiet and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: visitor111Boston_MA
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in had our own private balcony and was fabulous. I normally am pretty picky with resort town inns, however, this place met all of my expectations and more. The location to all the best Yountville restaurants as well as the nearby wineries made our stay a very good one. I would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing, couple of small niggles”
Reviews.Author: Adambe
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at the Yountville Inn, like many others I found it to be rather expensive for what was on offer and the room we had was very dark, despite blue skies and sunshine for the duration of our stay. We had a patio room that looked on to a small stream heavily shaded by trees and foliage. Our patio was not particularly private as a pathway ran longside it, but this was no big deal. The morning breakfast and complimentary tea, coffee and biscuits throughout the day were perfect for starting off the day or as refreshments whilst bathing by the pool. The rooms are very spacious and clean and well equipped with wine glasses and complimentary bottled water. A couple of minor points that I think could be rectified considering the cost of the Inn. 1) Water in the rooms is still heated by small electric tanks, these take a while to reheat after a shower/bath so make sure you allow time to allow the tank to refill if there is more than one of you getting ready for a day/night out. 2) The hotel offers wireless internet access throughout, but there is no pc with internet access for guests to use, this proved a bit of a pain as we wanted to check in for our onward flight online but were unable to do so. It doesn't cost much to buy a laptop for guest use and with the prices they charge, I think it they should make the provision. Overall, a great stay, the staff were pleasant, yet low key, on one occassion when we were locked out of our bathroom at 11:30pm they were very quick at resolving the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great, except for one thing...”
Reviews.Author: LttlRed
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms, great service, located centrally in a great little town. Only one compliant - the walls are paper thin and you could hear everything. Perfect stay except for that. One way to remedy - ensure you do not have a room above you.

Reviews.Title: “Wine Tour”
Reviews.Author: g0ne-walkab0ut
Reviews.Content: I was in Napa Valley for a tour of smaller vineyards, & didn't want to stay in Napa(town). The true benefit of Yountville is the abundancy of excellent restaurants. The closest restaurant is about 1/2 a block away (Ad Hoc - by Thomas Keller). The room was much larger then I expected. It did take me some time to find/figure out the HVAC, for such a large room I didn't expect it to be a wall unit. The only odd thing, was the room cleaning - in other hotels I've stayed in, if a sock or such is not in a pile/put away the staff puts it away; here though it was left where I had left it. I got the cheapest rate directly at the hotel website. The hotel is about 1 1/4 hours north of Marin County.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice, cosy hotel room”
Reviews.Author: cathjhdunn
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel. Nice rooms, great heated swimming pool. Good continental breakfast. Wine tasting discounts for Napa wineries. Loved our experience at Jessup one mile up the road. Some of the best restaurants in the countyr on your back doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Kennedy87
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the Napa Valley and we loved it. The Yountville Inn was the perfect starting point for each day. The town is adorable and the hotel was great. We had a room with a king bed and vaulted ceilings. The rooms were clean, spacious and comfortable. The fireplace was fantastic at night, as it was chilly outside. They had a great continental breakfast with a good selection of pastries, breads, fruit, yogurt, juices and coffee. If you want a full, hot breakfast you'll have to go elsewhere, but if you just need something to get you going for the day this is perfect. We visited other towns in the Napa Valley (Napa, St. Helena etc.) and both agreed that we were so happy to be staying in Yountville. We walked to dinner each night and felt very safe. Who needs room service when you're within walking distance of such great restaurants? When we vacation in the Napa Valley again we will definitely stay at the Yountville Inn.

Reviews.Title: “nice place but no wow factor”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night here. Good, spacious, clean rooms. Limited on-site facilities and no information in room as to what facilities were available. Breakfast was disappointing with a limited selection of not so fresh pastries, cereal and orange juice. No room service so you need to go to one of the local, pricey restaurants to eat. Seems to be frequented by an older clientele.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the ambiance”
Reviews.Author: FloridaVic
Reviews.Content: We cannot say enough good things about this place. Not only are the rooms beautiful, but all of the personnel there make you feel so special. They are there to help you in any way they can. We will CERTAINLY be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Lodging in Napa”
Reviews.Author: LCHRH
Reviews.Content: After 4 delightful stays, you won't be sorry for a stay at the Yountville Inn. They are in the MOST prime location in the Valley, the accommodations are beautiful (wine country toiletries, beautiful bedding, well-appointed bathrooms, a lovely pool) and adequate. The location is as good as it gets in wine country. I really hate to point more people in their direction!!! To be walking distance from Bouchon (my favorite restaurant in the country be it Vegas or Wine County for frites and oysters!!) or the French Laundry or our new love, Redd, you are in for a treat! We love ending a day of wine tasting on the patio at Chandon and then unwinding by the pool at the Yountville Inn. We've seen many a celebrity at the contintental breakfast (which also can't be beaten) at the Inn. Join many a wine club in the area and get a discount on your lodging. It's a home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Picky traveler very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: TwoMsOregon
Reviews.Content: We booked a 40th b-day getaway and our stay at the Yountville Inn was really excellent. I'm a hotel "snob" and really appreciate a nice place to stay. Our room was vaulted and very quiet, it had a nice private patio, and the breakfast pastries were top notch from a fabulous local bakery (not your typical greasy type of pastries). The room off the front desk was delightful in the evening offering wine tastings and in the morning served as a great spot to have coffee/tea, cereals or pastries and read the paper. The only complaint was that this room is a bit small and it was tough trying to find a place to sit at times. I think they need more seating out on the patio or by their pool just outside. The front desk staff was always pleasant, rooms very clean and parking was easy. We are booking a return for this May.

Reviews.Title: “Another enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: kht2006
Reviews.Content: We go to Napa wine country each Fall to pick-up our standing order of wine an do some wine-tasting. This is our second stay at the Yountville Inn. We went in Sept 2008 and stayed one Saturday night. I like it because it's in Yountville (small town, excellent restaurants, easy access to Silverado Trail and Highway 29). Also, rooms at the Yountville Inn are spacious as are the bathrooms. The breakfasts are tasty with plenty of variety - think continental "plus"... baked goods from the Bouchon Bakery, yogurt, cereals (hot and cold), and fresh fruit. We took a quick dip in the pool before dinner. There were plenty of chairs to lounge by the pool. It was very relaxing. Reservations were easy at the Yountville Inn's website. We requested two rooms next to each other, which we got with no problem. This time we traveled with my parents and my two children (4 y.o. and 10 months). I found the Inn to be child-friendly. Service was friendly. I will definitely return for future visits!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SJRinKS
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a great place to stay when visiting wine country!! Rooms were very comfortable - lots of accessible outlets for curling irons, hair dryers, & re-charging phones, ipods, etc. Beds and pillows were also very comfortable (extra pillows in the closet even). Iron & ironing board in room. Small fridge & coffee maker in room. Gas fireplace that turned on with a flick of a switch. Bathroom was GREAT!!! Toilet was in its own little separate room. Shower had a light fixture AND fan inside the shower so the steam stayed inside the shower -- so the mirror stayed fog-free and the bathroom wasn't humid after showering. Front desk was efficient, friendly, & helpful. Upon check-in, we were given an envelope full of complimentary tastings and/or discounts at several wineries. A continental breakfast was provided each morning -- Starbucks coffee, hot tea, fresh OJ & grapefruit juice, cereal, muffins/bagels/pastries, fresh fruit, yogurt, & hard boiled eggs. Every night the lobby also had a complimentary wine tasting from a different vinyard. Pool was heated & had a separate jacuzzi. Comfy lounges. Towels provided at the pool. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Yountville Inn Hit the Spot”
Reviews.Author: sagemum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Yountville Inn as part of a 10-year anniversary trip to Napa. I chose the hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and the hotel's site, as well as price relative to other properties in Yountville. We couldn't have been happier with our stay. The front desk clerk who greeted us was very friendly and respected my request for a quiet room, which we got. The room was very large and comfortable, well furnished with a huge bathroom, very nice bath products, feather pillows and comfy sheets and blankets. We stayed in a superior room, which I recommend if you can swing it for both the vaulted ceiling and the patio. We didn't need the fireplace, but it's a great touch in colder times. Thoughtful touches include plastic glasses to use by the pool, lovely robes and free wireless Internet access. We were amazed that even though the Inn was full while we were there, it was extremely quiet and peaceful; I slept in late despite the fact that the rooms next to ours were being cleaned--I simply didn't hear the cleaning people at all, which is so great. The staff was always courteous and friendly but never intrusive. As others have said, the breakfast from Bouchon bakery is delicious, and coffee and tea are available all day, along with cookies (also from Bouchon) in the afternoon. There was a free wine tasting during our stay, too. We spent the hour or so before dinner on the pool lounges, which are comfy and well shaded, and the pool itself is the perfect temperature. Best of all: Although we had booked the room in advance, I saw a Web special 2 days before our arrival, and the hotel honored that lower rate! We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and average at best”
Reviews.Author: em5555
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a wedding and while the hotel was more than adequate, it was nothing special for what we were paying. First, we were also put in the 'fishbowl" room described by another reviewer ie a room on the corner of the parking lot and a walkway with beautiful big windows where we could watch people go to breakfast and drive around the parking lot. Not quite what we had in mind. The room itself was very large but the furnishings were basic and there was no artwork on the wall at all - fine if we had been paying less money but nothing great. Before leaving the room for the wedding, we searched for a safe to put our valuables in - finding none, we called the front desk to ask where is was located. We were informed that not only was there no safe in the room, there was no safe in the entire hotel. This was huge disadvantage for us as we had flown in from overseas and had passports which we could not risk leaving in a room overlooking the parking lot. The inn also advertised a "lovely buffet breakfast." The first morning, we went over to the main building with visions of omelets in our mind only to find bagels, coffee, juice and yogurt - nothing hot. While the food was adequate (the baked goods were very good), this was not a buffet - it could accurately be called a "lovely continental breakfast." That morning as we were leaving our room we saw housekeeping and said our room would be available for the next few hours for cleaning but after that we would all be in the room getting ready for the wedding - they said they would take care of it. When we returned to our room at almost 3 pm, the room had not been touched. When we called the front desk, they were unapologetic and said that housekeeping had until 4 pm to clean - when we explained that we would be showering until 4 pm and had asked housekeeping to please clean earlier, they were unapologetic and borderline rude - it was almost as if they felt they had nothing to do with housekeeping. While the town and wedding were lovely, I would not stay at the Yountville Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Yountville Inn”
Reviews.Author: Sherry022
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Yountville Inn was delightful. The room was huge and very attractively decorated. The bed and sofa were comfortable, and the room was bright with two large windows. I thought it was a lovely place to stay. The room and bathroom were spotlessly clean and overall, I could not have asked for a nicer stay. The breakfast buffet was very attractively presented with breads and cheeses and delicious pastries from Bouchon. It was a real treat. The lounge area tables or poolside tables were also a pleasant area to linger over breakfast. The grounds were beautiful, and the front desk staff were gracious and helpful. Yountville is a great place to stay with wonderful restaurants and shops within easy walking distance. I'm sure that I will return to the Yountville Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay but poor service”
Reviews.Author: Christine15
Reviews.Content: We visited Yountville for a friend's wedding. The town itself is great!! So many wonderful restaurants- we ate very well while there. I would recommend this as a perfect place to see when in wine country. Let's start with the good things- the Inn is well kept, the rooms are large with spacious bathrooms, great pool, walking distance to many restaurants, clean, awesome continental breakfast with Bouchon pastries, coffee and tea available all day, and Gilchrist and Soames bath products that smell great. The bad- I requested a specific room in January and also called to confirm the week before. I was told that the room was available, but upon check in we were given a different room (and got some attitude too- "I don't know who told you you could have that room" and so on.) For the price of the rooms, I expect to be treated very well, this place should bend over backwards to please their customers, but it was poor service. (In reading past posts it seems to be a theme!) There are MANY great hotels in Yountville. If I go back I will likely try a different one. They also overcharged us when we checked out, luckily we caught it and they did refund the difference quickly- just check your receipts! All in all a great time, I would only stay there again if there were no other rooms available in Yountville because of the service. The hotel itself is great.

Reviews.Title: “Ok experience but avoid room #201”
Reviews.Author: ArwenUndomiel
Reviews.Content: The property is reasonably nice, but I had the unfortunate experience of being placed in room #201, which has a huge picture window opening up to the drive in area off the lobby, plus another window on a main walkway. It was like being in a fishbowl. If I wanted any privacy, I had to keep the heavy drapes closed. Plus I heard the garbage truck drive past my window at 5:00 am Saturday morning. The room itself was ok, but the lighting in the bathroom shower was very dark. When you're paying over $400 for a room, these issues are irksome. If you stay at the Yountville Inn, I recommend asking for a porch room vs. a high ceiling room (#201 had a high ceiling) - or ask for a room in the back of the hotel. The hotel's location is good since it is within walking distance to all the restaurants in downtown Yountville.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Sandy94108
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I live in San Francisco. We spend a lot of time in Napa, and Russian River. This was our first stay at the Yountville Inn. Normally we wouldn't have booked a room there, but we had won a 1-night stay from a silent auction event at City Hall. First the good news, it's walking distance to all the great restaurants in Yountville: Ad Hoc, Redd, French Laundry, etc. The bad news...the rooms are generally okay. For the price you pay you could actually stay elsewhere that is much nicer. I really believe they over charge for the rooms. Because of the comp'd room charge, it took them two days to figure out how to handle it on their end. At our arrival we asked them to switch the credit cards on the account, and to use my boyfriends card and not mine. Well, I just opened my Amex card, and of course there is a charge for the full two days on there. And there is a $56 credit on my boyfriend card. What the?! Can they not do simple math? I didn't think it would be that difficult to handle. But I guess for the Manager that I had been dealing with for two days isn't too keen on her math and/or computer skills. On an ending good note...make sure you have a chance to eat at Ad Hoc or Redd...they do a beautiful job!

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jeffsstuff
Reviews.Content: We originally planned to stay at a different hotel but, after seeing a review here on Tripadvisor.com we decided to change our plans. We certainly are glad that we did. While the Yountville Inn is somewhat further from the restaurants than some of the other hotels, it seems much nicer than many of them. It also compares very favorably in terms of price. the room was large with a large king-size bed, fireplace (gas), tall ceilings and a very large bathroom. The only thing that would have been better in the bathroom would've been to have had two sinks. As an added perk, the hotel provides pastries from the Bouchon Bakery at breakfast as well as midday. While we knew about the pastries in advance, we were surprised at the variety that was provided. Breakfast included fruit, pastries, breads, cheeses as well as orange and grapefruit juice, coffee and tea. The pastries were outstanding. They tasted even better not having to pay three dollars apiece as would be the case had we gone Bouchon Bakery. Breakfast was served in a large lobby area complete with comfortable chairs/sofas and a large fireplace. All in all, an excellent choice. When we visit the Napa Valley again, we will be sure to make the Yountville Inn part of our plans.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Room and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Explore_CFE
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Yountville Inn for three nights while exploring Napa. I think the location was the best part of it. You could walk to several great restaurants and nearby shops. The room had high celings and a lot of space. The beds were a little uncomfortable, but not bad enough to keep you from falling asleep, just a little bit of a sore back in the morning. We spent some time enjoying the hot tub and pool, although I would make sure you don't get a room too close to the pool because you would probably hear people out there or the gate opening/closing since people walk through that area to get to the lobby for breakfast. I was in building number 5 which was extremely quiet and the terrace over looked a small creek. The breakfast consisted of delightful pastries that I heard were brought in from the near by bakery Bouchon. There was also some cheese, fruit and hard boiled eggs. They also had starbucks coffees and teas available all day which was nice. check out was a breeze and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: moviegal226
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Yountville Inn, and it is a very nice property. We were booked in an accessible room by the swimming pool. Our room was literally next door to the pool! Out of our side window was the actual pool deck. This made privacy nonexistent, but our view was great. Plus, our room was close to the front desk and the lovely Bouchon pastry continental breakfast served each morning. Our accessible room was very large and extremely spacious. We had plenty of room for everything. The room features a nice king bed (be sure to request extra pillows; we thought the pillows were woefully inadequate and way too soft) flanked with nightstands and lamps, a separate seating chair and sofa, a small bistro table with 2 chairs, and a large chest with a huge plasma t.v. Our room had a lovely corner gas fireplace decorated with rustic lava rock. The accessible bathroom was well laid out, yet only had one sink. The accessible shower had no tub, but it was still very nice (with lovely slate surrounds). The in-room amenities (soap, shampoo, etc.) was adequate but far from luxurious. We had an in-room coffee maker with Starbucks coffee and hot chocolate, an ice bucket, two wine glasses and a corkscrew. A small in-room refrigerator stocks sodas for $3 each. The room has lots of windows, yet only one window has blackout curtains. The other windows have pretty white shutters. These shutters look great, but they do a terrible job keeping the room dark. Light sleepers might have trouble with this as the sun really does come through the slats and brightens the room very early in the morning. The grounds are lovely, very lush and green. Meandering sidewalks and modern sculptures abound. The rooms are set up to look like cottages, though they are all attached. It was easy and free to park. The room was spotlessly clean. The only major complaint I have is that when the water came out of our shower and bathroom faucet, it was SCALDING hot. You had to barely turn on the water or it would seriously burn you. Be careful if you stay here! The water was just way too hot! Also, I found the towels to be a bit thin, and the furnishings / bedding could use some updating. The heated saltwater pool is open 'til midnight and was really refreshing. The location can't be beat; you are within walking distance to many gourmet restaurants (including Bistro Jeanty and Thomas Keller's Bouchon and Ad-Hoc) and a 5 minute drive to a long list of terrific wineries. A convenience market and a Wells Fargo bank are also within one block's walking distance. This was a nice hotel and could really be a premier, upscale property with a bit of renovation. The staff was friendly, accommodating, and eager to please. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay in Yountville”
Reviews.Author: KBey
Reviews.Content: I booked theYounville Inn for 3 nights based on the recommendations I read on this web site. We requested and received a room in the back by the creek with a vaulted ceiling and patio. It was spacious and clean. The fireplace was great since it was a chilly weekend. We were unable to take advantage of the patio because of the weather. Nevertheless, we had minimal complaints. There was a wine tasting the evening we arrived. The breakfast was delicious. The only negative things I can think of is the walls are very thin. We could hear a conversation in the middle of the night in the next room. We were also unable to receive a wireless internet connection in our rooms even though they insisted we can. We dined at Ad Hoc, Redd and Brix. All were wonderful, especially Redd. I highly recommend it. Chandon Domaine Sparking Wine tasting room is right across the street. It was one of our favorites. We also loved, Miners, Plumpjack, Peju and GooseCellars.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic way to spend Thanksgiving”
Reviews.Author: CruisinWorld
Reviews.Content: Everything was really great at this hotel! We stayed here over Thanksgiving and we were given a room on the top floor that had high ceilings and a little sitting area. The free breakfast is wonderful. Great pasteries and good atmosphere. We had dinner at Bistro Jeanty (MUST HAVE THE TOMATO SOUP!!) great steak tartare. Thanksgiving day we ate at The Napa Valley Grille. Very basic and very good. Another great recommendation - the restaurant Cook in St. Helena - gnocci to die for. Also LOVED Whitehall Lane winery

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and friendly”
Reviews.Author: kod
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large with a sitting area, round table, gas fireplace, king bed, and spacious bathroom. The continental breakfast was fabulous because of the multiple pastries from Bouchon. The front desk was very willing to help me with making and cancelling a variety of reservations. The pool was nice and warm and the jacuzzi hot. My only criticisms are the lack of a computer in the lobby and no exercise room (even though you can use one for free nearby). I would still consider this property as many in the area, as a fancier motel.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at the Yountville Inn”
Reviews.Author: Ridgewatraveler
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a three night stay at the Yountville Inn. My sister in law and I booked a room as part of a "girl's weekend" to celebrate my 50th birthday. We requested and received a lovely Superior room with two queen beds at the back of the property near the creek, room 309. The room was large, exceptionally clean and well-appointed, with high vaulted ceilings, robes, nice towels, and twin vanities in the bathroom. Perfect to share. I'm pretty particular about beds, but found these to be fine - not too soft, not too firm. Like other reviewers, we noticed that we could hear neighbors through the walls. We couldn't make out voices, but a loud TV kept us awake one night. And yes, the toilet was loud but it was the new high-efficiency, low water variety that you find throughout much of the valley. The room had a window-type air conditioner and a ceiling fan which we found that we needed to run even on cooler days to keep the room comfortable. We had great service from the front desk - no rude staff on our visit. Breakfast pastries from Bouchon were great. Despite our high-season visit we were able to enjoy the pool and jacuzzi by ourselves most nights. The Inn's Yountville location is great for touring most of the valley. The property fronts a quiet street that is one block off the main highway, and features mature landscaping and some great garden art. And, it is two doors down from Redd, a great restaurant. Our only real complaint? Would have been nice to have a computer to use for e-mail and reservations. The Inn has wireless internet but you must bring your own pc. You will pay a premium to stay here during high season, but this Inn is less expensive than many other Yountville options. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Will Return Despite Rude Front Desk Clerks”
Reviews.Author: Barbara45
Reviews.Content: First, this hotel is located in Yountville (not Napa as Tripadvisor as it designated). It makes it difficult when searching for hotels in Yountville and this one does not show up when we were looking for hotels in Tripadvisor. We almost missed it! And that would have been a shame as the hotel is very nice. Our room faced a creek with a nice patio that we could relax and have coffee and dine on the fabulous pastries/fruit/bagels/juices they provide as part of the complimentary breakfast. We enjoyed a soak in the hot tub after a day of hiking at Robert Lous Stevenson park up in Calistoga. Also, hiking at closer Bothe - Napa Valley State Park was excellent. We were hoping to be able to walk to the French Laundry for dinner but it is about 7/10ths of a mile away and in nice clothes, wasn't feasible. The French Laundry, btw, was an amazing event. Six hours of dining. The only negative of our entire trip was the extremely rude clerks at the front desk. When we checked in, no one was there and when she finally came out, actually rolled her eyes and sighed. Despite being told our room would be ready upon arrival, she said no it wasn't. We walked downtown and shopped for an hour and half and came back and two different clerks were now at the desk. They also couldn't be bothered and quickly said the room was not ready. Their tone of voice was belittling and despite having traveled for many years, I have never encountered that many rude front desk clerks. It wasn't until a delightful, intelligent woman named Melanie arrived at work and suddenly the whole atmosphere changed. She must have been a manger or supervisor cause our room was ready within seconds of her arrival and the other rude clerks suddenly became quiet. We do plan on returning (we would like to try Ad Hoc next door and we can easily walk there from this hotel) but we cringe thinking about having to deal with those rude front desk clerks.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For Napa”
Reviews.Author: srp_2000
Reviews.Content: We got a last minute deal thru the Inn's website and we got upgrade to a Jr Suite at no charge. The room was perfect, by far the nicest place we've stayed in Napa. The breakfast was great too, they get baked goods from World Famous Bouchon - You can't beat that. Great pool too!. My only issue, one front staff worker was very rude, but the rest of the staff was great. We lost a pair of $300 sunglasses while staying there and this one person acted like we asked her to crawl around in the mud at night to find them. Just down right rude and then was also rude when we checked out by making some nasty comments.

Reviews.Title: “Big Room, Small Service”
Reviews.Author: KyleinJapan
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location and has the potential to be a favorite for visitors to the Napa Valley. For the cost of their accommodations, I expected a much more engaging experience than what is actually offered. As many have written in other reviews, there is no shortage of space in the guestrooms. However, we found the room to be dark during daylight hours since there is only one window (in our case a sliding glass patio door). Perhaps it would be more cozy in winter months with the fireplace but we couldn't feel comfortable in this cavernous room. The breakfast was consistently good, thanks to the hotel's selection of pastries from Thomas Keller's Bouchon Bakery. But what really dampened the stay was the indifferent service from the staff and management. During our stay there was a power outage in the town that affected the hotel. We walked to the lobby to inquire and the staff were standing in the dark behind the front desk. No one said anything about the issue until we inquired. Later that day when we return to the room, the clocks had not been reset. What a great service opportunity if the management had organized some teams to reset the clocks. It's only 51 rooms. In the mornings when we arrived for breakfast, no greetings from the staff in the lobby. Also, I would have expected the hotel management would use either breakfast or afternoon wine tastings as a chance to mingle with the guests. I couldn't help feel the Yountville Inn could only be described as an "upscale motel". It certainly has potential but will take some efffort. I wouldn't recommend to others at the cost prices.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: NeilMacUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 days. Very nice large room with patio, which was a little on the small side, however that is my only criticism. Friendly staff, excellent location, some super restaurants in walking distance. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Yountville Inn - the good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: baileyman
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 night stay at this Inn. On the plus side, the room was huge, wth nice decor, the bathrooms luxurious and the construction looked fairly new. The staff were very pleasant, the continental breakfast was deluxe - best ever, and the pool was fantastic. On the down side, we were shocked that we could hear our neighbors having a regular conversation and normal voice level coming thru the wall so clearly that it sounded like they were right in our room. I am not sure if this is unique to the buidling that we were in (we had room 202) as it seemed a more recent construction than the other buildings which are part of this inn. I also now noticed a very similar finding by some other review on this site dated about a year ago. If I return, I will definitely ask about the soundproofing in the other buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Casually elegant luxury in the Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: lagniappe34
Reviews.Content: This place rocked. It was exactly what I was looking for. I booked it sort of as a last minute getaway and a lot places were full but through a little research, I found out about the place. I was there on a Wed & Thursday night. Wed was $200 (which was bargain, I thought) and Thursday was $375 (a little pricier than I would have liked), but I was happy with the average (kind of). Its so nice. The room was really large. There was a full seating area with a sofa, chairs, table and fireplace. My room had a nice size patio, as well, with a somewhat obstructed view of the mountains in the background. I loved the bathroom layout. Ample space for my stuff, clean, nice towels. All very nice. The decor was just so pleasant, that's really the only way to describe it. It wasn't necessarily my style, but it was really comfortable and pleasant, sort of wine-country casual. There is not fitness center, which irks me at every hotel. They have a $15 dollar per day deal with a gym in Yountville, which I didn't utilize. The lobby area is really nice. All day long, they offer tea, coffee, hot chocolate and, the best part, cookies from Bouchon Bakery. ADDICTVE! They do a really nice complimentary breakfast - gorgeous pastries and muffins from Bouchon Bakery, fruit, hard-boiled eggs, bagels, cereals. For me, that is MORE than plenty for breakfast. I still walked to Bouchon for coffee, though. The pool and hot tub were clean and very relaxing after a long day of tastings. I really like the location of this. I could walk to any of the great restaurants in Yountville, which is a big thing for me. Overall - just really, really liked it. DEFINITELY recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Inn and fabulous location ...Westchester County NY”
Reviews.Author: andrea065
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with three family members went to this hotel June 6th through the 9th to celebrate his 40th birthday. What a great hotel and they couldn't have treated us better. The rooms are beautiful, large and very clean. The breakfast in the morning was terrific. The pool area was a perfect way to end the day. And don't get me started on the complimentary peanut butter cookies from Bouchon. They were too die for!! The Inn is in a terrific location. All of the wineries were just a short drive away. My favorite wineries were Schaffer and Pride. My husband had emailed them that it was his birthday and they couldn't have been nicer in setting up the wine tastings and touring the property. Each of these wineries went out of their way to make my husband's birthday special. We even got to taste some special bottles that are no longer available! As far as the restaurants in the area go, all the locals told us that Bouchon's was overrated. We should have listen. It was good, but nothing great. Same with Mustard's Grill. I did love Brix Restaurant-food was fabulous. .Next time I would do Redds. Heard really good things about it. Make sure you stop at the Oakville Grocery and take a picnic lunch with you. Pride has a beautiful picnic area as does Joseph Phelps (for Phelps you need to make a reservation for one of their outside tables-they were very snobby, my least favorite winery, although it is my husband's favorite wine). don't hesitate to stay at the Yountville Inn. It really is a great hotel with the nicest staff. You will not be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: hmi24
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in the quaint town of Yountville. The rooms were clean and quiet, the breakfast was more than enough to fill us up and the pool was very relaxing. I would definitely recommend this hotel. If possible, ask for a room towards the back of the property. Rooms 411 and 304 are usually requested. Excellent restaurants in walking distance ( Redd was YUMMY), many vineyards within 5 minute drive and the hotel also sponsors tastings in the lobby on certain evenings. The service was also extremely helpful. The only downfall is that they do not have a business center, but if you have a laptop they allow you access to their wireless internet. My husband and I found the public library in St. Helena (next town up the road) and were able to use the internet there for free. No big deal, I was on vacation so I think it may have been a good thing to not have immediate computer access. As far as Vineyards - recommend Buehler Family, Cakebread's wine and food pairing as well as Frog's Leap. All were excellent and extremely informative and did not feel too commercialized if you know what I mean!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful spot”
Reviews.Author: luxuryhound
Reviews.Content: The Yountville Inn is great! The rooms are spotlessly clean, spacious and well appointed. There is a small outdoor pool that is just right for a quick cool off. Breakfast is simple and can be collected from the foyer and taken to your room or eaten in the very tasteful 'parlour' area to gentle sounds of classical music. There is absolutely no need to pay the extra money for a hotel with full restaurant and bar and there is a plethora of fantastic restaurants to choose from within very easy walking distance of the hotel. Yountville is very well situated right in the middle of the main Napa wine growing area with Callistoga, St Helena and Napa itself all within 20 minutes drive. The area and the hotel are well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic! The rooms were spacious, beautifully decorated and the bathrooms were magnificent. The Inn has a standard outdoor pool, a lobby area that has complimentary wine tastings on Friday nights, The famous Bouchon Bakery caters the continental breakfast every morning in the lobby. The staff could not have been more accomodating. The rooms had gas fireplaces and were very romantic. It is located right offf Rt 29. Highly recommended for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: SanFran35
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this property several times since the time of inception. Over the years the property has become a little stale but I just stayed there in August and had a very nice time. Hotel staff are pleasant and accommodating, rooms are nice (if a little tired) and the pool area ia nice (but tends to be overrun with kiddies at the weekend in high season so not great for a 'romantic getaway' if that's what you are after). I just booked another stay there with a bunch of my girlfriends for a Saturday in December and was told that new sofa beds have been installed in the room so sounds like they are making improvements. I always really enjoy Yountville and this place is very well located and walking distance to all the restaurants in the village. They even provide a bike rental service which is fun to cycle around the vineyards. Overall thumbs up for this place for the value compared to other properties in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, comfortable accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Billiken
Reviews.Content: NOTE ON RATING: This was our first trip to Napa. Our friends and, effectively speaking, our guides, had been here many, many times. They like the Yountville Inn for its comfortable accommodations and convenient location. I agree. While it is not the Four Seasons, it is a very comfortable property, clean, easy to utilize, with a nice, if not modest, breakfast presentation. I am a runner and this property makes walks and or runs extremely convenient based on its location. Great streets to run on inclunding the road that wraps around the Yountville Hills, about a 6.5 mile run to Highway 29 and back. I was told that they are adding a wine Bar to the lobby which would be great. This is probably 12 months out from what I was told. I have not tried other accommodations in Yountville, but I would go back. If it helps, we typically seek out Four Seasons type accommodations and we were satisfied with this property despite its simplicity. Cannot help but make one comment on the restaurants. We ate at four different restaurants: Mustards, Bistro Jeanty, Tra Vigne, and the Culinary Institute in St. Helena. My favorite, by far, was Bistro Jeanty. Excellent food, great service. And, it is about two blocks from from the Yountville Inn. Finally, if you want to have a great tour of a winery, try to get a tour of Pride. Extremely informative. Also, Kuleto is wonderful, but not easy to get to. One drawback on the Yountville Inn was that in the pool area, you could hear the cars going by both on Washington Street and on 29.

Reviews.Title: “Soundproofing and decorating need work”
Reviews.Author: PoppyQuince
Reviews.Content: We checked in to this property hoping for a relaxing stay in the wine country and were upgraded at check-in. Our room was quite dark, with one full-size window and another small one high up in the wall. The ceiling was chalet-style and sloped up to about 15 feet. The furnishings were dark wood with dark green and burgundy colors in the carpet and upholstery, and the gas fireplace was set in a wall of stones next to the hulking armoire. This might have felt good on a ski slope in the dead of winter, but was only depressing in the Napa Valley in early September. The problem that was really annoying however became evident later, when we heard clearly the conversation of our immediate neighbors. They were speaking at normal conversational level and we heard it all. I'm glad they weren't having a fight! And they did go to sleep at a reasonable hour. This room cost $308 including tax. While I know that hotels in the area can charge pretty much whatever they want during the season, we definitely felt it wasn't worth anything like that amount.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasing hotel in Yountville”
Reviews.Author: Naha
Reviews.Content: We were at Yountville Inn over Labor day weekend. The inn is very quaint and small - but perfect for its purpose. It is at the "end" of the Yountville "strip" I'd call it. Literally right off the exit..... The Front Desk is fine. The girls working there could be a bit more cordial, but their services suffice. The inn does not have turn down service, if you need extra towels for the morning and etc. make sure to call in advance. They do not have maids/cleaning staff during the evening so if you do need more towels make sure to ask the morning cleaning lady or else you have to go to the Front desk to ask for more towels in the evening. The rooms are good in size, plenty big and we got teh best priced rooms. Fireplace, double sinks, good water pressure in shower and etc. However the rooms are a bit dark, b/c limited windows but its great for what it is. The breakfast is good for what it is. Mostly pastries, hard boiled eggs, fruit and more pastries :) Also a variety of cereals/juices/milk. Everything is in walking distance in the area, its a very nice area. We have been to Napa before, but stayed in the other surrounding areas and think that Yountville was the best place to stay. French Laundry, Bouchon are both in walking distance from the hotel. French Laundry is totally worth it, what an experience - we loved it. Bouchon is also by chef Thomas Keller and a GREAT restaurant as well. We will most likely stay at the Yountville Inn when we go again, the only other one we liked in the area was The Vintage Inn - check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, convenient location but poor service at the front desk.”
Reviews.Author: Max_P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Yountville Inn in late July. We love to visit Napa for 2-3 night getaways and have stayed on other properties. This was our first stay at Yountville Inn. We were referred by our wine club and received a slight discount on room rates. Overall we were pleased with the property and it's convenient location in the Napa valley. The rooms are nicely furnished and comfortable. The pool was pleasant and the grounds well kept. However, we were disappointed in the lack of professionalism exhibited by the front desk staff. Spending $300/night (after discount), one would expect some type of concierge service, or at least a front desk staff capable of assistance in making local dinner and spa reservations. When we asked for dinner recommendations the staff was unable to make any with confidence. When we asked about spa services, we were handed some phone #'s and told to "try these".

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: raskinco
Reviews.Content: We had perfect stay. The property is immaculately maintained and there was an obvious attention to every detail. We had an upstairs room with vaulted ceiling. It is a nice size room and the vaulted ceiling make feel even bigger. As with the rest of the property is was very clean and well maintained. I had read reviews complaining about the beds, but we found no problems. The matress was firm, but not the least bit uncomfortable. The shower pressure was the best I have in hotel since the 70's. The cleaning crews were even quiet. You never heard them cleaning rooms around you at the crack of dawn. Again they really pay attention detail and know that people are there on vacation. Since it is an Inn there are not the ammentaties you might find at othr full service hotels. No spa, no room service. The pool is not huge, but there are quite a few chairs and tables, and again it is really clean. The staff was very nice and accomadating. They have a simple complimentary breakfast with Bouchon pastry. The pastry sets this breakfast apart. They also make sure they don't run out of things even if you are a late riser. Yountville is great place to use as home base on your trip Napa Valley. It is close to the middle of all the Napa towns and about 20 minutes from Sonoma. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay as nice as the first”
Reviews.Author: Tar Heel Bill 92
Reviews.Content: I just visited Napa with 2 friends and I booked us for 2 rooms at the Yountville Inn. I had stayed there last year in July with my partner and another friend and had very much enjoyed our stay. This year's stay was as enjoyable. We stayed for 2 nights from Wednesday through Friday, so we got a good rate (by Napa standards) of $225 per night for each room. (In comparison, the Vintage Inn was offering smaller rooms for $400 per night.) My room was very spacious, with a king bed, a living area, and a sizeable bathroom. I also had a sizeable balcony area, but since my room overlooked the parking lot it was a bit of a waste. Still, my friends had the same room overlooking a nice garden area, so we would often sit out there on their balcony in the evenings before and after dinner with a nice bottle of wine and just hang out. It was quite hot again during our stay, and I am one of those people who always likes it very cold, and again my room temperature was pretty good with the unit's air conditioning. I've had better, but then again I've also had MUCH worse, so I was pretty pleased. I asked if they could bring a fan to help me keep cool and they quickly brough a HUGE fan for that purpose. I was comfortable for my entire stay despite the fact that temperatures ran well over 100 degrees during the day and even at night it was around 75-80 degrees. The complimentary continental breakfast wasn't my favorite, since they ran out of bagels and muffins that I most liked, but it was more than adequate. There was fresh juice and very good coffee (or so my friends tell me as I don't drink coffee), and the hard boiled eggs are a favorite of mine, so I had plenty to tide me over. Of course, the Inn is very well situated with great restaurants like Bistro Jeanty and Bouchon (and the French Laundry, of course, which I still think is fabulous but way overpriced) just a 10-15 miniute walk from the hotel. Very convenient. I very much enjoyed my stay for my second visit and expect that I will make the Yountville Inn my staple place to stay in Napa Valley when I visit with frends. I have stayed at Auberge du Soleil when I am there with only my partner, but then our budget is bigger than most of our friends'. Still, I very much enjoy my Yountville Inn stays and am surprised that it is not more highly ranked here. For the record, the Vintage Inn rooms seem totally dated and the Vintage Inn itself seems more of a factory than a charming Inn, and the Yountville Inn is far superior in my estimation.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been nicer!”
Reviews.Author: Yanks1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Wine Country a few times and this is the first time we stayed at the Yountville Inn. We received a daily discount because of a wine club we belong to - I learned about this from another TripAdvisor reviewer - worth checking into! We had a really large room with a vaulted ceiling, on the corner of building 6 overlooking the pool which was a heated salt water pool - very relaxing. The room had a fireplace (though it certainly wasn't needed in June!), a small couch for TV viewing, a refrigerator, and best of all, a really tremendous bathroom with double sinks, separate toilet and beautifully designed tub area. (Don't know how important this is to anyone, but it had the best water pressure of anyplace I've ever stayed in - great for invigorating showers!) The breakfast had exceptional pastries and even had hard boiled eggs for those carb watchers! Coffee and fruit was very good too. Room was very clean. Front desk staff was not overly friendly but nice enough. Location of the Inn is excellent. Take a trip to Sonoma if you want to experience some free wine tastings - they are not as snobby about wine as Napa can be. Good eating at Mustard's, Napa Valley Grill, Bistro Don Giovanni's. All in all, a great trip and we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SOG-Joker
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Yountville Inn Weekend of April 1ST.Very Quiet Location, Beautiful Creek next to our room. The Inn is Beautiful, The Rooms are Huge and gorgeous, bathroom was very nice. Bed Good , not Great. Good continental breakfast. Great Location right in the middle of Napa Valley. Less Than 30 mins From most Wineries. Small Pool and Jacuzzi, but it was Rainy, so never went in.A very good Motor Inn, with 3 Diamond Level amenties.OverPriced, as are all Napa Hotels.I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet”
Reviews.Author: centralcoastlove
Reviews.Content: We switched over to the Yountville Inn after a bad experience at the Vineyard Country Inn in St. Helena. Our room was wonderfully clean and comfortable; the beds were fine and all appointments were above average. We had a downstairs room with a fireplace and small patio that faced out onto a creek. Very quiet and peaceful. The front desk staff was most helpful and friendly; they gave us coupons for free tastings at several wineries, which was appreciated, and St. Supery did a tasting at the hotel on Friday night. Breakfast was leisurely by the fireplace, reading the WSJ or NY Times. We thought this was a great deal at $125 per night. On the weekend, the rate doubled to $250. Yountville was very nice, much more enjoyable than the bustle and traffic of St. Helena. The best meal we had was at Martini House; Cindy's Backstreet Kitchen and Greystone at the CIA were also excellent. Mustard's was fun. Reservations are a must everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend in wine country”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last week and thoroughly enjoyed our time here. The rooms were roomy yet cozy at the same time. The breakfast was outstanding for a continental breakfast. It might be a little expensive but we got a price break for this time of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The service was great, my Superior room was outstanding. The bad part was no restaurant on site so no roomservice BUT you are within walking distance of great restaurants, why would you order in? I would return but never at $375 a night, I will wait for specials/off season.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: small hotel but extremelly confortable, not cheap but very cosy. good breakfast included in the room price.

Reviews.Title: “Good base in Napa”
Reviews.Author: NickandEd
Reviews.Content: We stayed in September 2005. The room (701) was large with a vaulted ceiling and a fireplace. Our room overlooked the pool area. It was very comfortable and well appointed. The layout of the inn is a little motel-ish, with the rooms accessed from outside and a spiderweb of paths to reach them. Breakfast is help-yourself and was very pleasant; a range of pastries, bagels, muffins and yoghurt. Tea and coffee are always available in the reception area, the reception team were very helpful. The pool and hot tub looked lovely - although we didn't have time to try them. Yountville itself is full of lovely places to eat and they are all close to hand. Would recommend the inn as a place to stay if you are visiting the Napa area and are looking for a central base to return to.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but very expensive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I take a trip to the wine country every year and try to stay in a different place each time to try new spas/towns. This year we chose the Yountville Inn. I can't complain much about the hotel. It was very clean, and when I made my reservations the desk manager was as helpful and pleasant as anybody I've every dealt with. He even sent me an email with suggested spas, wineries, restaurants and the like. Very nice touch. Moreover, he offered to make my dinner and spa/tasting appointments for me. Very nice touch. The room was immacculate with country theme. Very high vaulted ceilings and stone/gas fireplace. Nice pool area, nice grounds and the continental breakfast served in the lobby (complementary) was decent. The food was nothing special but the ambience was very nice and comfortable. I enjoyed eating breakfast in the morning sun lit room reading a complementary copy of the San Francisco Chronicle. The hotel is nestled right in Downtown Yountville so spas, restaurants, shops, etc. are just a short walk. Very cozy. That being said, our bed was very uncomfortable, it was as if we were sleeping on a sheet of plywood. Very hard. I did not sleep well at all. My main issue with this hotel, however, was the price. At $375 a night, I felt it was too expensive. There is no room service, and no restaurant on site. Moreover, there is no spa or even a gym attached, (so we walked one block to Villagio for spa treatments). Given that this is 'just a hotel' I think $375 ($420 after room tax) was far too expensive for what we got. We stayed at the Lodge at Sonoma last year, in their highest end "Cottage" which was like a small condo with exquisite decorations, large room, comfy bed (even equipped with a memory foam topper - WOW!) and private veranda. The Lodge, with nicer rooms, attached spa (fantastic by the way!), restaurant on site (Carneros), and bar service out to the pool (Excellent!!) was a better value and actually cost less than $375/night (but you sacrifice the downtown locale). While the Yountville Inn was a decent experience we will not return at that price. I would expect to pay about 189-200/night but no more, and the bed has to be more comfortable. Also, while the room was a fine size (not small by any means), it looked far more spacious on the web site - caveat emptor.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up!”
Reviews.Author: Keysmickey
Reviews.Content: Great room! The fireplace and vaulted ceiling were wonderful and the bathrooms were nicely oversized and luxuriously furnished. Very romantic (but we had our kids with us). Not to worry we're going back in a couple of months, just the two of us. We had a great weekday rate and when we weren't able to take our hot air balloon ride either day of our initial stay due to weather we wanted to come back later in the week (on our way back towards SF) to try again and the staff not only found us a room, despite being busy, but surprised us with the extension of our weekday rate despite being a Friday night!!! Oh, and the balloon ride was magnificent! Great hotel, friendly staff fantastic location.
